Incidentally, the state government has already introduced organic farming of vegetable items along the Ganga in 12 districts, which has been christened as Organic Corridor and is linked to the rail network on both the sides of the river. Further, the farmers willing to go for the organic farming of vegetable items are being given input subsidy.

Choudhary said the farmers would also be helped by eNAM, an online trading platform to access National Agriculture Market and discover prevailing suitable price for agricultural produce in the country.

In the 2020-21 Union Budget, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced provision for agricultural produce storage facilities for which godowns will be constructed at a cost of Rs 2 crore each, Choudhary said, adding the farmers would be able to stack their produce at the godowns. “By tracking the agriculture commodity price through eNAM, they will be able sell their produce at desired prices,” the minister added.

He said the Centre has made budgetary allocation of Rs 1.50 lakh crore for promoting agricultural and allied activities, besides creating infrastructural support. “It has been the highest allotment made so far. Before 2014, the allocations made in the Union Budget for agriculture and allied activities never exceeded Rs 30,000 crore,” he added.

Title: NHAI waives FASTag fee till Feb 29 to encourage device use
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

PATNA: In a bid to encourage the use of electronic toll collection device FASTag, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has waived the fee for issuing tags till February 29. While the adoption fee of Rs100 has been waived off, motorists still have to pay the security fee and minimum balance for getting FASTag.

The radio frequency identification (RFID) tag facility, which is mandatory for driving vehicles on national highways, can be availed from point-of-sale locations at toll plazas, regional transport offices (RTOs) and online.

“In order to increase digital collection of user fee via FASTag at national highway toll plazas, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has decided to waive off the FASTag fee of Rs 100 from February 15 and 29, 2020,” a statement issued by the ministry of road transport and highways on February 12 reads.

However, the number of people using FASTags have increased. Sanjeev Kumar, toll plaza manager at Patna-Bakhtiyarpur NH-30 said, “The number of motorists issuing FASTags has increased in the last 15 days. Around 50% of vehicles passing through the toll plaza have FASTags sticked on their windscreen. Earlier only 30-40% vehicles that passed through the toll plaza had the tags. Besides, the number of private vehicles with RFID tag is comparatively higher than commercial and heavy vehicles, including trucks.”

He added: “Around 80-90 motorists issue FASTags on a daily basis. People are eventually understanding the benefits of the tags. With FASTags they don’t just experience a seamless travel but they save a lot of time too.”

Meanwhile, several motorists claimed of having issues with banks owing to the issuance of FASTags. “The initiative of making FASTags mandatory is very good. However, NHAI should give a complaint number to us in case we face issues while getting the tags. I issued the tag long back but I am yet to receive it,” said Nishant, a resident of Kankarbagh.

Sharing similar problems, Sanket Raj of Boring Road said, “I applied for FASTag via my bank as they were issuing it for free but it has been 15 days and there are no updates.�

Title: Swanky Bihar Sadan in Delhi likely to be ready in 4 months
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

PATNA: ‘Bihar Sadan’, a swanky 12-storey new guest house of the state government in Delhi will be ready in next four months, a senior government official told CM Nitish Kumar here on Monday.

Coming up on a two-acre plot in Dwarka Sector-19 area, Bihar Sadan will be third guest house of the state government in the national capital after two existing houses – Bihar Bhavan and Bihar Niwas.

“Construction work on Bihar Sadan is going on at a fast pace. It will be completed in the next four months,” state’s building construction department (BCD) principal secretary Chanchal Kumar said while making a presentation before the CM on re-development plan of the existing Bihar Bhavan and Bihar Niwas. The presentation was made at a high-level meeting held at Sankalp hall in the CM’s official residence here.

BCD minister Ashok Choudhary, who also attended the meeting, said the CM directed construction companies to hand over Bihar Sadan to the state government in next three/four months. “It will be ready in next four months,” Choudhary said.

Being constructed at a cost of Rs 78.78 crore, the new building will have 10 floors besides basement and ground floor. It will have 118 rooms, a conference room for 200 people and cafeteria for 180 people. It will also have an exhibition area for 200 people and parking facility for 224 vehicles. Of 118 rooms, there will be eight VIP suites, two VVIP suites, 89 double bedrooms and 19 single bedrooms.

“Once completed, it will provide accommodation to dignitaries from the state, including the governor, CM, ministers, legislators, high court judges, state government and guests from other places,” a BCD official told TOI.

After reviewing the presentation on the re-development plan of the two existing guesthouses, Nitish asked the BCD officials to focus on renovation of Bihar Niwas in the first phase. He advised the officials to construct an auditorium on the premises of Bihar Niwas.

“Under the redevelopment plan, there should be enough provision for residential accommodation of the officers and employees working at the Bihar Niwas on the same premises. It will be better if we can make arrangement on a fixed rate for common people who visit Delhi for treatment at different hospitals,” Nitish told the officials.

He asked the officials to prepare a better draft plan after studying designs of other important buildings. “Senior officials should visit the location time to time to ensure that renovation work is executed in a better way,” Nitish said.

He further asked the officials to spare certain portions of Bihar Bhavan to accommodate Delhi-based offices of the state government.

State’s chief secretary Deepak Kumar, cabinet secretariat department’s principal secretary Deepak Prasad and the secretaries to the CM Manish Kumar Verma and Anupam Kumar also attended the meeting.

Title: Mega Jain monks meet to discuss reform plans
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Surat: Four years after Shree Tapagachchiya Shraman Sammelan in Palitana of Bhavnagar district, 36 monks from 18 different Jain sects are meeting at Guru Ram Pavan Bhoomi at Pal in Surat to review the resolutions they had taken, their implementations and future plans.

In the Palitana convention, Jain monks had passed over 40 resolutions providing guiding directives to the monks, nuns and followers of Jainism.

According to the Jain leaders, the-three-day important sammelan that began on Monday would discuss main issues of Jainism and monks.

In 2016, it was for the first time in the recent history that 18 sects of Shwetambar Jainism had come together to discuss the common issues. More than 2,500 monks and nuns had participated in the event in which thousands of devotees from India and abroad were present.

“Now, this three-day mega event has been convened to review those resolutions, its implementations and future plans. Among those to be present in the event include Abhaydevsuri Maharaj and Dolatsagarsuri Maharaj. Acharya of all the 18 sects along with the Jain leaders are going to be present at the event,’’ Shrenik Vidani, a Jain leader from Surat, told TOI.

During the Palitana meet, some of the resolutions included stopping unnecessary pomp at religious events, providing extra care to the ancient religious places, but refraining from unnecessary revamp, focusing on Jain teachings at schools, constituting educational and research institutes for Jainism to identify ancient Jain pilgrim spots, motivating more from the religion to assume public roles, providing alternative to the idols kept in areas where Jains no longer live, no construction of new tirtha on highways and using technology for digitizing information from various scripture repositories in India.

The meet had also unanimously decided to abolish the current custom of bringing the body of a monk, sadhvi or acharya to a specific place for the last rites. It was decided that the acharya would perform the last rites at the nearest place, reducing the use of vehicles for transport.

“It was felt that all those resolutions passed in Palitana meet four years ago should be reviewed and the status of its implementations and future plans should be discussed,” added Shrenik Vidani.

Title: SGCCI mulls consultant to study of textile sector woes
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Surat: The Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SGCCI) on Monday proposed appointment of a government-approved consultancy firm to conduct a detailed study of the problems and issues faced by the country’s largest man-made fabric (MMF) sector.

SGCCI had convened a meeting of the textile industry stakeholders from different sectors on Monday including powerloom weaving, yarn spinners, textile processors and traders to discuss on the issues. It was unanimously decided to appoint a consultancy firm to prepare a detailed draft of the issues faced by the industry to be presented to the central government for consideration under the ‘textile policy-2020’.

Talking with TOI, SGCCI president Ketan Desai said, “Around 14 issues concerning the sector were discussed. We have unanimously decided to appoint a government approved consultancy firm for the detailed study.”

Desai added, “The major issues faced by the textile sector is related to the anti-dumping duty on filament yarn, cheap import of fabrics from China, issues related to GST taxation, power subsidy, refund of the input tax credit (ITC) etc.”

The meeting decided to represent the central and the state government for simplifying the bank loan restructuring norms and increasing the repayment of the term loan period from six years to 10 years.

Ashish Gujarati, president of Pandesara Weavers Association (PWA) said, “Apart from foreign trade agreement (FTA) and the dumping of cheap fabrics, we want the government to come out with the ‘one nation one power’ scheme for the benefit of the industries”

Ashok Jirawala, president of the Federation of Gujarat Weavers Association (FOGWA) said, “The state government had announced power subsidy in the new textile policy, but the weaving sector is yet to get the benefit. We want a resolution from the state government regarding this.”

Title: Youth dies in bike mishap, selfie goes viral
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: A 19-year-old youngster, riding a bike, lost his life when he rammed the bike into an auto coming in the opposite direction in Kamareddy district on Sunday night. A selfie video of Pradeep Goud taken a before his death has gone viral.

Goud worked in a toddy compound in Rajampet village. On Sunday morning, Goud and his friend went to Vemulawada to attend a function. After the function, Goud was on his way back home. “While returning to Rajampet, Pradeep recorded a selfie video while riding the bike. In the video he kept repeating the words ‘love failure’. The accident appeared to have occurred over one hour after the video was recorded,” Devunapally SI Srikanth said.

The accident occurred at Ugrawai village. “He fell from the bike and died on the spot with a severe head injury. Pradeep did not have a driver’s licence and did not wear a helmet,” the SI said. A case was registered under Section 304-A of the IPC. TNN

Title: Action plan being worked out to minimize coal imports
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Bharuch/Surat: Union minister for coal and mines Pralhad Joshi on Monday said India has fifth largest coal reserves in the world, yet it continues to depend on imports.

The Union minister, who inaugurated a two-day national conference of coal and mines department at the Statue of Unity at Kevadia, said the purpose of the meeting is to chalk out an action plan to minimize imports and make the country self-sufficient in coal. The BJP-led NDA government at the centre has brought transparency in auction of coal mines. Now anyone one can apply for lease of a coal mine in the country, Joshi added.

Coal India, a public sector undertaking, has prepared an action plan to mine one billion tonnes of coal by 2023-24.

The conference is being attended by senior officials of coal and mining ministry and public sector undertakings.

Title: Oyo’s FY19 losses jump 6x to $335m on China woes
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Bengaluru: Oyo Hotels and Homes has said its consolidated losses — including global operations — grew over sixfold to $335 million (Rs 2,390 crore) for the fiscal ending March 2019 as it expanded outside India at a breakneck pace, especially China.

The Gurgaon-based startup, which is backed by Japan’s SoftBank, said its India market loss stood at $83 million (Rs 592 crore), while it contributed about 63% to the total revenue of the company at $604 million (Rs 4,308 crore). This further shows its international expansion was the main factor for the ballooning losses overall.

The company said its total 2018-19 revenue is $951 million (Rs 6,784 crore), showing a growth of 4.5 times compared to the previous year. For the last one year, Oyo has been expanding across the US, China and Europe. India and China are its largest markets.

Both Rohit Kapoor , Oyo’s CEO for India and South Asia, and Aditya Ghosh , now a board member of Oyo, told reporters the company is working towards a “clear path to profitability”. China, which is its largest market, is also fighting the novel Coronavirus crisis and it has impacted its business there.

Ghosh did not comment on the impact on bookings and said that it’s a developing situation. “Absolutely there will be an impact, maybe for the short term. If I zoom out a little bit on our business in China, our business has grown and as the market matures, we expect to continue to reduce our losses, improve revenues and move towards a path to profitability (in China),” he added.

According to a blog post, Oyo saw almost $200 million (Rs 1,427 crore) of losses in China over revenues of $307 million (Rs 2,190 crore) for the year ending March 2019. Oyo did not give its room inventory country-wise, but said it now has over a million rooms across the world.

The focus on profitability comes at a time when Oyo’s model has come under severe scrutiny across the globe following SoftBank-backed WeWork’s failed IPO attempt, which also disclosed several governance issues in the company. Large startups, across the world, are seeing investors demanding more answers on their plans to be profitable and not just grow at any cost. Oyo has also been facing unrest of hotel owners over issues like payments, both in India and China.

“Revenue in India in the fiscal 2019 went up to $604 million from $210 million (Rs 1,498 crore) a year ago. The gross margin has moved up to over 14% from more than 10%,” Kapoor said, citing growth in India business.

Title: LICHF digitises loans using Google Cloud
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Mumbai: LIC Housing Finance has digitised its home loan application process through Google Cloud services. This will speed up the process by enabling customers to upload applications and documents using a mobile app.

According to the company, loan disbursement will also be speeded up as several steps will get automated. The system will validate the applicant’s PAN details and compute loan eligibility. Applicants can also pay the processing fee through the app.

LICHF MD & CEO Siddhartha Mohanty said that the company is targeting millennials through the channel. The app will be useful for existing as well as prospective customers. Existing customers can use the app to engage with the company and download documents, including statements and tax certificates. “We are seeing a shift in the demographic profile. Those in the age group 25-30 are looking to buy a property and to capitalise on these opportunities you need to be agile in your delivery systems,” said LIC chairman M R Kumar.

Compatible with Android and iOS, the LICHFL home loan app is built on a microservice-based architecture that runs on Google Cloud Kubernetes Engine. The app also features an interactive chat application built on Firebase and DialogFlow that enables it to respond to loan queries from customers, with security managed by Cloud Armour.

“The advanced features and reliable performance of the app will enable LICHF to engage a new generation of customers across India, and provide greater convenience and choice for home loan applicants,” Kamolika Peres, director of sales at Google Cloud in India.

Title: CII suggests guidelines for corp governance
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Mumbai: Self-regulation is a key factor in greater responsibility, integrity, and accountability for rebuilding and sustaining trust, for companies, according to CII .

If India is to move to a leadership position in the global corporate space, business strategies can only be effective if complemented with responsible governance and ethical actions, it says.

It feels this is time to review the earlier Desirable Corporate Governance Code 1998, and recommend updated guidelines on integrity and transparency in governance.

The CII guidelines are an attempt to serve as the base for corporates (large and small; listed and unlisted) to redesign their governance strategies in the face of ever-changing business and regulatory environment. The guidelines enumerate 15 recommendations on topical issues covering integrity, ethics and governance; responsible governance and citizenship; role of high-performing board; balancing interest of stakeholders; independent directors and women directors; safe harbours for independent directors; easier settlement norms and amnesty provisions; risk management; succession planning; role of the audit committee; improving audit quality, and enhancing accountability of other third parties who play a fiduciary role; disclosure and transparency related issues; vigil mechanism; stakeholder, vendor and customer governance; investor activism and startups and MSMEs.

These guidelines are a combination of global practices; existing legal provisions (some of which may currently be applicable only to listed companies); good-to-have principles; regulatory policy suggestions and forward-looking concepts — aimed at enhancing the overall governance standards of companies in India.

Title: One in four heart-ailment patients in Kolkata under 40
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: Around a fourth of the city’s heart patients is now aged below 40 and nearly 10% of them don’t survive their first heart attack , often due to late intervention, according to senior cardiologists. It still takes around 60 to 90 minutes for a heart-attack patient to be transferred to a cathlab table for a life-saving primary angioplasty at the city’s private hospitals. Experts felt that more lives can be saved if this time is reduced.At BM Birla Heart Research Centre — which celebrated its 30th anniversary on Monday — a process has been activated to reduce the ‘door-to-balloon time’ or the time taken to open a cardiac patient’s blocked artery from the moment of arrival. Around 90% of heart-attack patients seeking treatment at the hospital are now treated at the cathlab within 40 minutes.“We have multiple teams to expedite the process of treatment once a cardiac patient reaches our doorstep. From the managers at the desk to the lift operator, barber, nurses and doctors, everyone makes sure that the patient’s family doesn’t have to stand in queue for the admission formalities. The moment it is decided that a patient needs angioplasty, we activate the code ‘heart attack’ and everyone involved in the process makes sure that not a second is wasted,” said interventional cardiologist at BM Birla Anjan Siotia.It is now possible to carry out a primary angioplasty within half-an-hour of the patient being brought in, said Medica Superspecialty Hospital’s head of cardiac surgery Kunal Sarkar. “Most private hospitals have the infrastructure and the personnel to do it. It is indeed a life-saver,” he said.AMRI Hospitals, one of the first to introduce primary angioplasty in the city, claimed that its ‘door-to-balloon’ time is 70-75 minutes. “According to US guidelines, it should be less than 90 minutes. We have managed to bring it down to 70. But often, a lot of time is wasted since patients’ families have to be convinced about the necessity of the procedure,” said AMRI Hospital’s head of department of cardiology P K Hazra.Along with dietary habits, diabetes and smoking, stress has emerged as the leading cause of heart attack, especially among the youth. We have at least a couple of patients in their twenties every now and then, which would be very rare a decade back. Every month, we receive two-five patients in their thirties, which is a significant number as well,” Siotia said.Young cardiac patients are likely to suffer a more lethal heart attack and their chances of survival were lower than elderly patients, pointed out an interventional cardiologist with a private hospital.“You wouldn’t suspect a heart ailment in your thirties and will be more reckless about your diet and lifestyle. Few go for health check-ups, so diabetes and cholesterol often remain undetected. More importantly, a young patient does not develop collateral blood circulation — flow of oxygenated blood that bypasses blockages in the main artery and allows cardiac tissues to survive — which often saves the lives of chronic, elderly patients,” he said.

Title: Four lakh contractual teachers go on strike in Bihar, face action for skipping exam duty
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Approximately four lakh ‘Niyojit’ (contractual) teachers of government schools in the state went on an indefinite strike from Monday in support of their eight-point demands, including equal pay for equal work.

The strike, which has been organised under the banner of the Bihar Rajya Shikshak Sangharsh Samanvay Samiti (BRSSSS) coincided with the beginning of the Matriculation exams conducted by the Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB). However, the government claimed that the teachers’ protest had no adverse impact on the exams.

Education department additional chief secretary R K Mahajan told TOI, “The government had made it clear that tough action will be taken against those who boycott the examination duty. Their salaries will also be deducted.”

Mahajan also instructed all the district magistrates, municipal commissioners, deputy development commissioners and district education officers to prepare a list of the teachers, who are boycotting examination duty, disturbing others or creating hurdles in the process of answer sheet evaluation, and lodge an FIR against them. He had written a similar letter on February 7 as well.

“The strike has not had any impact as we had roped in permanent teachers, contractual teachers of senior secondary schools and old teachers recruited before 2006 for conducting the examinations,” Mahajan claimed.

Education minister Krishna Nandan Prasad Verma condemned the teachers’ protest and called it unfortunate. “Exams are important for shaping children’s careers. It is unfortunate that teachers have gone on strike at this time. We cannot fulfil their demands because we are abiding by the Supreme Court order,” Verma said.

On the other hand, teachers, who have gone on strike, warned the government of dire consequences if their demands were not fulfilled. They also claimed that academic activities could not be carried out in 76,000 government schools on Monday.

In a press release, BRSSSS convener Brajnandan Sharma stated, “We will continue with our strike until our demands are fulfilled. Any punitive action against a teacher supporting us will make our movement more aggressive.”

One of the members of the BRSSSS (Patna), Prem Chandra, alleged that the education department had sought the help of nursing staff and Anganwadi workers for conducting the examinations.

Title: Bihar Assembly Elections 2020: Prashant Kishor likely to reveal Bihar assembly election plans today
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Prashant Kishor

PATNA: All eyes will be on poll strategist Prashant Kishor who is expected to make an announcement about his plans for assembly elections in the state here on Tuesday.

Kishor’s political advocacy group I- PAC has its fully functional office in Patna and media persons have been informed that he will address a press conference at 11am on Tuesday.

Those in the know said Kishor would not associate himself with any political party in Bihar as poll strategist. He, however, did not confirm to a query raised by TOI in this regard through a text message on Monday. “Will talk about it formally when I meet media in Patna at 11am on Tuesday,” he replied to the query.

Speculations are rife about Kishor’s future course of action. It is still unclear whether he will associate himself with any opposition party in the state or strengthen his forum for youths. The forum, ‘Youth in Politics (YIP)’, has 2,38,054 members from Bihar, if its official website is anything to go by. YIP’s website states that it is a first-of-its-kind pan-India platform for youth between 18 to 35 years of age to join active electoral politics under the mentorship of Prashant Kishor and I-PAC.

I-PAC handled Narendra Modi's prime ministerial campaign in 2014 Lok Sabha elections and Nitish Kumar’s chief ministerial candidature in Bihar in 2015. Later, I- PAC worked for Congress in Uttar Pradesh assembly elections. It also worked for Jagan Mohan Reddy in Andhra Pradesh, Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi and Mamata Banerjee in West Bengal.

Before I-PAC started working with Reddy’s YSR Congress, Kishor was inducted into JD(U) in September 2018 and made party’s national vice-president a month later.

Though JD(U) national president Nitish had called Kishor “future of politics”, things came to such an extent between the two in little over a year that the latter was removed from JD(U) on January 29 on charges of crossing party lines by making statements against Nitish.

Kishor has been a staunch opponent of Citizenship (Amendment) Act, which was supported by JD (U). He is also against proposed National Register of Citizens.

Meanwhile, the state Congress and RJD functionaries have ruled out any talks with Kishor. Vikassheel Insan Party (VIP) founder Mukesh Sahni had claimed last week that most opposition parties in Bihar were in touch with Kishor.

Title: Bihar: 50 expelled across state on Day 1 of Matric exams
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An impersonator was caught in Gaya and 50 students were expelled for using unfair means across the state on the first day of Matriculation examinations conducted by Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) on Monday. Action was also taken against two magistrates in Nalanda district for dereliction of duty.

The BSEB issued a press release in the evening, saying the examinations were conducted peacefully across the state. To ensure fair examinations, the BSEB had prepared 10 different sets of question papers. BSEB chairman Anand Kishor visited some examination centres and instructed the officials on duty to be strict.

Altogether 15,29,393 candidates, including 7,83,034 girls, wrote science papers on the first day at 1,368 centres across the state. In Patna, the examinations were conducted at 74 centres.

Two magistrates face heat in Nalanda: Nalanda district magistrate Yogendra Kumar Singh ordered issuance of show cause notices against two magistrates – Mohit Kumar and Jayesh Kumar Sinha – after finding that students were communicating with one another in the examination halls. While Mohit was deputed at Biharsharif's Allama Iqbal College, Jayesh was on duty at Aadarsh High School. The DM also ordered removal of invigilators – Upendra Singh and Furqan Alam from Allama Iqbal College, Dayanand Mishra from Adarsh High School and Chanchala Kumari and Karuna Kumari from Nalanda College – for mismanagement.

Nalanda district education officer Manoj Kumar said of 47,689 examinees at 36 centres in the district, 1,189 did not take the examination and 11 were expelled for using unfair means.

Bagaha teachers wear black armbands: In spite of the strike called by contractual teachers, the Matriculation examinations were conducted peacefully in Bagaha. However, permanent teachers wore black armbands as mark of support to their contractual counterparts who were on strike.

Lathicharge in Motihari: Police resorted to mild lathicharge on the onlookers and some guardians near Prabhawati Gupta High School in Motihari after they tried to create trouble. Motihari SDM Priyranjan Raju reached the centre and brought the situation under control. The Matric examinations were conducted at 56 examination centres in East Champaran district. DM Raman Kumar said Section 144 had been promulgated near all examination centres.

49,561 write papers in Bhojpur: A 15-year-old examinee, Riya Kumari, came in contact with a live wire after returning from an examination hall. Riya, a resident of Farhada village under the Barhara police station area in Bhojpur district, was staying at her the house of her father’s friend at Sankat Mochan Nagar locality to write papers. Meanwhile 49,561 students appeared at 36 centres in the Matric examination in the Bhojpur district . District public relations officer Pramod Kumar said 103 magistrates, 80 police officers and a large number of police personnel were deployed at examination centres.

Fake question paper: Sitamarhi DM Abhilasha Kumari Sharma said the question paper doing rounds on social media was a fake one. A team headed by civil SDO Kumar Gaurav investigated and zeroed in on those involved in spreading the rumour.

No expulsion in Begusarai: The examinations passed off peacefully in Begusarai district. Begusarai district education officer Devendra Jha said no candidate was expelled in the district. He said the strike by niyojit teachers had no impact on the examinations.

(With inputs from Farrukh Nadim, Tirthraj Kushwaha, Chandra Bhushan Pandey, Praveen, S K Singh and Rajiv Kumar)

Title: Bihar: Police nab Muzaffarpur elderly couple’s domestic help
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The Muzaffarpur police on Monday claimed to have cracked the case related to the murder of a 65-year-old retired officer of registration department, Ajay Kumar Sharma, and his wife Renu (60), following the arrest of their former domestic help, Nitesh Kumar.

The duo was found murdered with a blunt weapon at their residence under the Brahmpura police station area in Muzaffarpur on January 8. The murder of the elderly couple, stated to be close relatives of a senior IPS officer posted at the state police headquarters, had sent shock waves among the residents of the town.

Muzaffarpur city SP Niraj Kumar said Nitesh had confessed to the crime and revealed that he was furious after Renu misbehaved with him over some issue. “Although I had lost my job almost a year ago, I used to work in the house on certain occasions. The greed to make a fast buck coupled with misbehaviour compelled me to killed them,” he reportedly told the interrogators.

Nitesh had escaped with Rs 50,000 and the couple’s cellphone from the house. He disclosed that he purchased a motorbike for Rs 34,500 and spent the remaining amount on other articles. The bike and the stolen cellphone were seized from the possession of Nitesh.

The city SP told mediapersons, “Two suspects were, earlier, sent to jail in connection with the incident and Nitesh was under the surveillance of the special investigation team, headed by DSP Naresh Paswan. Police swung into action and arrested him as soon as evidences corroborating his involvement in the double murder case were found.”

Nitesh was produced before the local court, which remanded him to judicial custody for 14 days. “The investigating officer has been asked to take Nitesh on remand for further interrogation in the case. All the three accused will be quizzed again in the wake of fresh evidences,” the city SP added.

Title: Kerala: Muslim man marries off his Hindu foster daughter
Content:
Role Model: Kasaragod native Abdulla Abdurahiman and his wife were part of the marriage rituals at Manyottu te... Read More

KANNUR: Rajeshwari was not his daughter but ever since the day she reached his home around 15 years back, after the death of her parents, she has been like his daughter. So, when she became a grown-up girl of marriageable age, Abdulla Abdurahiman, who is from Melparamba in Kasaragod, knew it was his duty to marry her off, that too as a Hindu , because she was born a Hindu.The girl, now 22, was married to Kanhangad native Vishnuprasad on Sunday, at a simple function at Manyottu temple in Kanhangad as per Hindu rituals, and Abdulla and wife were her parents at the function and were part of the rituals.“Her parents died when she was a little girl and I knew them well as her father Saravanan had worked in my home as well. So when Rajeshwari’s relatives brought her here, I received her just like my daughter and she grew up here only, with my three sons,” he said.Though Rajeshwari was not keen to go to school, she helped the family in all ways possible, said Abdulla, 68, who added that she was not a housemaid there. Even though her people took her to their native place in Thanjavur, she returned in a few months and never wanted to go home, he said.“I have not legally adopted her but she is a daughter for me and my wife Khadeeja right from the beginning, so we were happy to solemnize her marriage too, after a suitable bridegroom was identified,” he said.Vishnuprasad’s family wanted the marriage to be solemnized in a Hindu temple. But Abdulla and family were bit too tense, as they are Muslims and will not have entry to a Hindu temple. It was then somebody said Manyottu temple in Kanhangad permitted entry to Muslims and hence the marriage was solemnized there, he said. His three sons, 84-year-old mother Safiyumma, and also their relatives had attended the wedding.“I never thought of religion or faith and simply thought of her marriage, because it is my duty,” he said.

Title: Centre keen to talk to Shaheen Bagh protesters: Ravi Shankar Prasad
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Ravi Shankar Prasad

BIHARSHARIF: Union minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Monday said the Centre was “inclined” to talk to those protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at Shaheen Bagh in Delhi to remove their “confusions,” but maintained at the same time that if they (protesters) have “other objectives”, action would be taken against them.

“The Centre is eager to talk to them and remove all their misgivings about the CAA, but the problem is you can awake a sleeping person, not the one who is pretending to sleep,” Prasad told reporters here.

“People have right to dissent, but they can’t be allowed to conspire to disintegrate the nation. Terrorists and separatists who are operating from behind to fuel the protests to weaken the nation will be defeated,” he added. “No person will be allowed to break Hindustan,” the minister said.

He said the “desperation” of terrorists and separatists became more visible after the BJP alone secured 303 seats in the general election held under the “dynamic leadership” of PM Narendra Modi in 2019. The minister, who represents Patna Sahib seat in Lok Sabha, said the BJP-led NDA government at the Centre has been constitutionally resolving long pending issues, such as Article 370, Ram Temple and Citizenship Act.

Describing the anti-CAA, NPR and NRC protests as “sponsored,” Prasad said the opposition parties were spreading lies and misinformation for their political gains.

“The CAA grants citizenship to persecuted minorities from certain countries. It in no way deprives any Indian of his or her citizenship as is being falsely claimed by the opposition parties and other vested interests,” Prasad said.

He said even the then Assam and Rajasthan CMs – Tarun Gogoi and Ashok Gehlot, respectively – had demanded implementation of CAA in their states when Manmohan Singh was the Prime Minister.

Title: ‘Faulty’ old marksheets found dumped at SSC board office
Content:
These marksheets were those that had some faults and kept aside

PUNE: Hundreds of old marksheets with holograms of secondary school certificate (std X) and higher secondary certificate (std XII) examinations were found strewn around in a room on the third floor of the Pune division office of the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education in Shivajinagar on Saturday afternoon.After the incident was brought to the notice of the state board chairperson, the marksheets were immediately disposed of as per the rules.These marksheets were those that had some faults and kept aside. Some had misprints or some defects with the cutting, some did not have the security hologram. Some of them were returned due to wrong names or seat numbers, among others and were kept aside.The room in which these marksheets were found lying around had no security. Moreover, there was no one to question people entering the building or visiting the third-floor room on Saturday afternoon. Shakuntala Kale , the chairperson of the state board, stated that the building was under renovation, but accepted that it was “careless” on part of the officials at the division to keep the marksheets lying around.Employers, colleges and universities often receive forged marksheets at the time of admission or employment. The third-floor room of the Pune division would have given miscreants an easy opportunity to lay hands on them and misuse them.Among paper scraps and several documents kept in the room on the third floor, the marksheets were found lying in carton boxes, some spilling out and lying on the floor.Kale said, "These are discarded marksheets and since the renovation is underway, the officials may have kept them in the room. However, I admit that the process is not being followed and this is very dangerous. Immediate action has been taken by the divisional chairman after my calls and we will ensure that such carelessness is avoided in future."The interiors of the building are under renovation and officials at the Pune division said that the paper scrap was being kept in a room and was to be taken up later for sorting.Pune division chairman BK Dahiphale admitted that the marksheets were very carelessly strewn around in the room. "It was wrong to keep those marksheets the way they were kept in the room without any security. It was wrong on the part of the officials as they kept those boxes along with other paper scrap. However, as soon as we got to know about it, we disposed them of as per the rules."Dahiphale said that such marksheets need to be kept for maximum of one year and after that they are disposed of as per the state board rules. "However, in this case it seemed that the marksheets were older than one year. However, we have taken necessary action on the matter," he said.

Title: Experts for highlighting role of IPR
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

PATNA: Academics, technocrats and industry professionals from different parts of the country highlighted the crucial role played by Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) in the economic development of the country on Monday. They pleaded for propagating its awareness in every section of the society.

Addressing a two-day national workshop on ‘IPR and Patents’ organized by the National Institute of Technology-Patna (NIT-P), they pointed out that in today’s globally competitive environment, intellectual property (IP) was becoming increasingly important. “It is the fuel that powers the engine of prosperity, fostering invention and innovation,” they added.

Experts like Pondicherry Engineering College’s faculty member and Institution of Engineers (India) chairman Raman Sarvanane, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research principal scientist R Sivacoumar, and Patents and Designs (Kolkata) deputy controller Parijat Saurabh said, “IPR is nothing, but a creative work of human mind and refers to the legal ownership of an invention or discovery by a person attached to a particular product. This right clearly protects the owner against unauthorized copying of his product.”

They pointed out that countries that protect intellectual property had higher economic growth rate.

Workshop convener L B Roy said, “In the modern era, the ability to translate knowledge into innovation and its subsequent commercialization will determine the future economy of the country.”

NIT-P deputy director S K Verma said the workshop was intended to increase the level of awareness about IPR and patents among the participants. College faculty member N S Maurya proposed the vote of thanks.

Title: Immunity cover to allow JSW takeover of Bhushan Power
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Reeba Zachariah | TNN

Mumbai: An appeals court on Monday allowed JSW Steel’s Rs 19,700-crore purchase of bankrupt Bhushan Power by offering it immunity from criminal proceedings in relation to offences committed by the target company’s previous management. However, prosecution against Bhushan Power’s erstwhile promoters can continue, the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal ( NCLAT ) said. The Bhushan Power transaction, when completed, will strengthen JSW’s position as the largest steel maker in the country with a capacity of 23 million tonnes.

JSW’s deal to acquire Bhushan Power ran into rough weather after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized the latter’s assets in connection with a money laundering probe against its founder. The steel major subsequently moved NCLAT, seeking immunity from all present and future liabilities arising from criminal proceedings against Bhushan Power, contending that the absence of such a protection will risk its acquisition. The Bhushan Power deal follows JSW’s recent buy of insolvent Monnet Ispat & Energy for Rs 3,700 crore.

The NCLAT bench led by Justice S J Mukhopadhaya also ruled that the operating profit earned by Bhushan Power during the insolvency period will go to JSW.

The judgment is in line with the recently amended insolvency law that protects a bankrupt company, after its resolution, from criminal liabilities arising from the acts of the founders. While investigative agencies can continue to probe wrongdoings of previous management, they cannot touch properties of companies that are under the insolvency process.

In the case of JSW-Bhushan Power, the ED had argued that the legal immunity introduced in December will not apply to JSW as it was prospective in nature. It also said that since JSW and Bhushan Power were once related — the two were strategic partners in Rohne Coal Company — the Sajjan Jindal-controlled metal major cannot take the legal immunity benefit under the amended insolvency law. The appellate tribunal bench, however, turned down these objections. Analysts said that JSW’s purchase of Bhushan Power could turn out to be expensive as the company’s debt rose even as demand for steel has been dipping amid an economic slowdown.

In a separate development, Jindal’s energy company has inked an agreement to acquire a 1,050MW thermal power plant in Odisha from GMR for Rs 5,321 crore. The transaction will ramp up JSW Energy’s capacity to 5,609MW and strengthen its presence in east India. JSW Energy said that GMR Odisha fits with its strategy of acquiring assets with low power-generation costs and minimising receivable risks. The transaction, subject to regulatory approvals, will have to be completed within 90 days from the date of the share purchase agreement.

Title: Balayya’s accountant held for forging wife’s signature
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Actor-turned-politician Nandamuri Balakrishna’s accountant was arrested on Monday for allegedly forging signatures of the MLA’s wife to activate mobile banking facility for their accounts.

Jubilee Hills police arrested K Shiva Kumar alias Shiva, 34, an assistant accountant with NBK Films LLP, Anna Nagar, Balamrai, Secunderabad, owned by actor-producer-MLA Balakrishna and his wife Vasundharadevi, for forging their signatures.

Shiva Kumar, 34, forged the signature of Vasundharadevi on HDFC Bank application form and submitted it to the bank asking for activation of the mobile banking feature, Jubilee Hills police said.

“The managers of HDFC Bank’s Banjara Hills branch, Phaneendra and Srinivas, contacted Vasundharadevi’s representative, V Subba Rao, on February 13 to enquire about the application furnished to activate mobile banking feature. Subba Rao and Vasundharadevi told bank officials that they had not applied for mobile banking. They also called Shiva Kumar and confronted him about submitting the application at the bank. Shiva confessed before his employers and also the bankers that he had forged the signature to download the app and easily check account balance and account statements instead of doing multiple rounds to the bank,” Jubilee Hills inspector Sattaiah said.

Based on the complaint lodged by Subba Rao, police registered a forgery case against Shiva Kumar under Sections 467, 468, 471 r/w 511 of the IPC. Shiva was arrested on Monday and produced before court. He was sent in judicial remand.

Title: Himachal approves new excise policy
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Shimla: Himachal Pradesh cabinet on Monday gave its approval to the 2020-21 excise policy, which envisages collection of Rs 1,840 crore revenue during the year, which is Rs 215 crore higher than the previous financial year. The cabinet, in a meeting held here under the chairmanship of chief minister Jai Ram Thakur, also approved the renewal of retail excise vends in the state to facilitate enough increase in government revenue, reduction in liquor price and to curb its smuggling from the neighbouring states.

The new excise policy also allows 30% of country liquor quota for liquor manufacturers and bottlers to be supplied to retail licensees. The remaining 70% quota can be lifted by retail licensees from suppliers of their choice. It also proposes taking FDR/bank guarantee from retail licensees as security in the shape of property in order to secure government revenue.

From the next financial year, all imported liquor will be supplied by public custom bonded warehouse in the state. The policy extends operational timings of bars in all star related hotels and bars in specified important tourist areas from noon to 2 am.

The cabinet also gave its nod for the HP Toll Policy for 2020-21, which has an option for renewal of lease after paying 1% fee for the year and an increase of 10% over the bid amount for the previous year. Approval was also been given for the capacity expansion of distillery from 45KL per day to 85 KL in favour of Premier Alcobev Private Limited Sansarpur Terrace in Kangra district.

The state planning board has allocated Rs 7,900 crore for 2020-21, which is a Rs 800 crore increase from the amount allocated in 2019-20.

Title: Four of Marathi’s gang members held for aiding his murder
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Surat: Four members of the Surya Marathi alias Suresh Pawar gang were arrested on Monday for their alleged involvement in murder of their own gang leader in Chowk Bazaar last week.

Those arrested include Amul Jine, the complainant in Marathi murder case; Safi Shaikh, Munna Dudhwala alias Shukla and Vikas Magre.

Investigation revealed that the accused were in touch with Hardik Patel, former aide of Marathi, who had led the attack on Marathi on February 12. Police suspect bigger conspiracy behind Marathi's murder and involvement another gangster who is backed by those dealing in disputed properties.

Another member of Marathi's gang Jayesh Paul was also booked for Marathi’s murder. He is on the run.

Cops had earlier arrested Satish alias Satya alias Babu Marathi Dhagde and Rahul alias Apartment Piple on February 14. They are in police custody till February 20.

Marathi was stabbed to death at his office on Ved Road last week. Four others, who were part of the gang that attacked Marathi, are yet to be arrested.

Hardik, who had led the attack on Marathi was also killed during the counter attack by Marathi.

“The accused did not interfere or not even try to stop the attackers. Since day one their involvement was suspected and their call records show that they were in touch with the attackers,” said a police officer.

According to police, Amul and Safi were in contact with Hardik over phone.

“Marathi’s gang members told police that the former was rude and did not share gang’s earnings with other members. While Hardik used to share the earnings equally among all,” said a police officer.

“It is suspected that many people were taken in confidence before executing Marathi who had developed contacts in real estate and political circles in past few years,” said a police officer.

Title: Jamia video leaves Kolkata students seething in anger
Content: KOLKATA: The visuals of security personnel thrashing students inside the library of Jamia Millia Islamia that surfaced on Sunday have shocked the student community in Kolkata. The 50-second video from a CCTV footage shows security personnel breaking the door of the library and beating up students with batons.The attack on the students in Jamia turned out to be a significant turning point in anti-CAA movement, leading to several protests and sit-ins throughout the country against the new citizenship law which demonstrators have termed discriminatory and unconstitutional. “This is state-sponsored terrorism on students. The video exposes the lies by the Delhi Police and the home ministry, which had claimed that police never entered the library,” said Debabrata Sinha, a student of Presidency University where students have organized and participated in several anti-CAA protests in the past two months.The video, which has gone viral on social media, contradicts the police’s claim that they did not enter the Jamia library on December 15, the day protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act flared up leading to clashes in the Capital.“It is shocking how the security personnel are beating up the students. It only proves what we had been saying so far that the police entered the university library and rained batons on the students,” said Sunetra Samajpati, pursuing MPhil from Calcutta University.At least 90 students, residents and police personnel were injured in the December 15 clash, which began after officials refused anti-CAA protesters permission for a march. The police resorted to firing tear gas shells to disperse the protesters.Students of Aliah University have demanded action against the security personnel who entered the library.“We criticize the cowardly act of police beating up unarmed students. A complaint must be registered and strict punishment should be meted out. We also urge all sections of the society to come forward to resist the fascism,” said Kazi Minhazul Islam of Aliah University.In Jadavpur University, where several students’ outfits have made CAA and NRC a poll plank in the union elections, said the BJP government was using the police to curb dissent among students. “The BJP government is using police to intimidate the student community because we are asking uncomfortable questions on jobs, education, economy and Kashmir. Universities are free spaces for debates and counter-arguments, and the police and state should not interfere with it,” said Sameek Ghosh who is pursuing post-graduation in international relations.

Title: Jadavpur University VC appeals for harmony during union elections
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

KOLKATA: Jadavpur University vice-chancellor Suranjan Das has issued an appeal for cooperative and constructive harmony on the campus on the day of the union elections. In a signed letter, the VC also appreciated the efforts of the students for being on the forefront of various movements for social justice, awareness and equity.

ABVP has fielded candidates in the union elections for the first time — both in the engineering and humanities streams.

“It is a matter of pride how calm, peaceful and orderly the elections on the campus have been in the past. We have set an example for other institutions across the country. I am sure the same tradition of cooperative and constructive harmony will prevail and we will witness the peaceful and democratic exercise of their franchise by the students,” the VC wrote.

The election is due on Wednesday and the result will be announced on Thursday. More than 4,500 Arts students, around 2,400 science students and more than 700 engineering students will vote to elect 13 office-bearers. That apart, more than 600 class representatives will be elected as well.

Nobody could recall the last time a VC issued a plea for peaceful elections on campus. Last September, hundreds of JU students gheraoed Union minister Babul Supriyo on campus when he arrived to attend an ABVP programme. The students showed him black flags and raised slogans. Later, Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar drove to the campus and “rescued” the minister.

Title: Kolkata: Association backs VC in row with governor
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

KOLKATA: The forum of vice-chancellors has thrown its weight behind the Coochbehar Panchanan Barma University vice-chancellor Debkumar Mukhopadhyay, who has been pulled up by governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, the chancellor of the state university, for not intimating him about the varsity’s third convocation that was held on February 14. Dhankhar’s predecessor Keshari Nath Tripathi had attended the second convocation.

Dhankhar served a show-cause notice on Mukhopadhyay for “seriously compromising the dignity and position of the chancellor”. The notice reached the VC hours before the convocation.

The Coochbehar university had told TOI they followed the government rules. Mukhopadhyay on Monday placed the issue in the West Bengal Vice-Chancellor’s Council meeting, where the members expressed concern over the notice, which arrived with a directive from Raj Bhavan that a reply must be sent within a fortnight. After the meeting, one of the members said, “We would like to submit that the state rules stipulate the procedure regarding conducting inquiry, issuing show-cause or taking any penal measures against VC and pro-VC.” “Panchanan Burma University VC Debkumar Mukhopadhyay had acted according to the new framed by the state government,” read a statement by the VCs. Jadavpur University VC Suranjan Das presided over the meeting.

JU VC was referring to the government rules that leave no scope for any direct communication between the chancellor and the VCs of state universities. Going by rules, VCs are to propose the convocation date to the higher education department, which might intimate the chancellor.

Dhankhar invoked Section 9 of Coochbehar Panchanan Barma University Act, 2012 that deals with removal of a VC. Some varsity officials wanted clarity. “But the rules are made in conformity with university Act. What happens when rules supplant relevant portions of Act?” an official said.

Title: Two JD(U) legislators sing paeans to Tejashwi Yadav’s ‘yatra’, raise eyebrows
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Tejashwi Yadav

PATNA: JD(U) MLC Javed Iqbal Ansari on Monday came out in support of the leader of opposition Tejashwi Prasad Yadav’s ‘Berozgaari Hatao Yatra’, describing it as a “welcome initiative” for highlighting the issue of unemployment and migration in the state.

Tejashwi has announced to begin his ‘yatra’ from the Veterinary College ground here on February 23 in an apparent bid to expand his party’s support base among youths ahead of the assembly elections in the state later this year.

“What is wrong if Tejashwi has planned to take out a ‘yatra’ to raise the issue of unemployment and migration? Today, unemployment is a burning issue in each family, each household, each caste and each social group in Bihar . I support Tejashwi’s ‘yatra’ while rising above the party line because he is raising a real issue,” Ansari, who was in his home district Banka on Monday, told TOI over phone.

He said Tejashwi’s ‘yatra’ has raised a ray of hope among lakhs of unemployed youths in the state.

Ansari, who recently called on incarcerated RJD chief Lalu Prasad at a Ranchi hospital to enquire about his health, even urged the JD(U) chief and CM Nitish Kumar to support Tejashwi’s ‘yatra’ by rising above the party line.

“Nitish Kumar ji should come forward and tell Tejashwi that he supports his yatra because it is being taken out for a genuine cause of youths. As all political parties in Bihar supported prohibition in the state, JD(U) chief should also support ‘Berozgaari Hatao Yatra’ and join hands with Tejashwi to exert political pressure on the Centre on the issue of unemployment,” Ansari said.

Ansari’s move to support to Tejashwi’s yatra caused ripples in the state’s political circles, especially in the ruling JD(U). JD(U) state president Bashishtha Narain Singh, however, tried to play down his party MLC’s support to the yatra. “There is no need to attach any importance to an individual’s support to Tejashwi’s yatra. It is just a tactic to gain publicity. It is not going to affect the JD(U) at all,” Singh told media persons.

Another JD(U) legislator, Hayaghat MLA Amarnath Gami, also expressed concern over unemployment and the state government’s failure to check migration of workers to other states, but he later clarified that he was not in support of Tejashwi’s yatra.

“No doubt, there is widespread unemployment in Bihar. Had there been no unemployment, people would not have left Bihar to work in other states. They are working in states like Maharashtra, Gujarat and Delhi despite facing humiliation there. No government in Bihar ever worked to address this issue of migration. All political parties will have to focus on the issue,” Gami told TOI over phone.

To a question on Tejashwi’s yatra, Gami said, “This gigantic problem will not be solved only by Tejashwi’s yatra. Tejashwi should inform people about the plans he has in mind to solve the problem.”

Gami also claimed that he was currently not associated with any political party. “I am a JD(U) member only in the assembly. I will follow the JD(U)’s line only in the legislative house. At other places, I have freedom of expression,” he said.

Title: Bihar: Skyrocketing LPG prices hit households and eateries
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The skyrocketing prices of LPG cylinders are burning holes in the pockets of residents and food business owners in the city. The 14.2 kg subsidised cylinder is now priced at Rs965 in the city, which was Rs816 on January 1 this year. Similarly, the commercial LPG cylinder now stands at Rs1,670.

Homemakers are reeling from the hike in cylinder price which has increased exponentially over the past five months. “Onions, garlic, pulses, bread and now LPG; prices of everything are increasing. The government does not seem to be concerned at all about the common people. I am not able to manage my monthly budget,” said Smita Verma, a resident of Kankarbagh.

Kadamkuan resident Payal Kumari said, “The price of LPG cylinder has now gone beyond my reach. But I can’t even remove it from my kitchen as I won’t be able to cook without it.”

Amit Kumar, an LPG dealer in Hanuman Nagar, said, “LPG rates change on the first day of every month, however, due to the Delhi election it was postponed. Unlike every month, the increase isn’t of Rs30-Rs40 but of Rs149, which is quite expensive for most of the residents in the city.”

Restaurant owners, too, are at their wits end. “Unlike onions and garlic, we can’t replace LPG cylinders. In fact, 99% of the restaurants in the city use LPG cylinders for cooking. We can’t start cooking on coal all of a sudden,” said Rakesh Jaiswal, owner of a restaurant on Gola Road.

“I have decided to increase rates of food served at my restaurant due to the surge in LPG prices,” said the owner of a restaurant on Boring Road.

Market experts and the state-controlled oil marketing companies (OMC) in the city said prices of domestic as well as commercial cylinders change every month based on the international rate. “The prices have increased by more than Rs300 in the past six months. Last year in September, a 14.2kg LPG with subsidy was being sold at Rs684 and commercial 19kg cylinder was being sold at Rs1,271. The international market rates of LPG are quite high, due to which the prices have increased in India,” said Anita Kumari, the proprietor of an OMC in SK Puri.

She added, “Those who have already made the online booking, will also have to pay the revised amount. However, people who have made online payment prior to the increase in LPG prices won’t have to pay any extra amount.”

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Two arrested with 24 pistols, ammunition
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: The Government Railway Police (GRP) personnel at Pt Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction in Chandauli district caught two carriers of arms smuggling gang and recovered 24 pistols and 48 magazines from them on Sunday while Ballia police arrested two arms smugglers with country-made revolvers on Monday.

The arrested carriers were produced before Chandauli court on Monday and sent to jail.

Inspector GRP DDU Junction, R K Singh said, “Our team noticed two suspicious youths with three heavy backpacks on platform 2/3 during routine checking drive on Sunday afternoon. On checking of their bags, 24 pistols and 48 magazines were found.”

The two, identified as Jamaluddin and Saleem, residents of Bokaro, revealed during interrogation that they were involved in coal trade but had been recently called by a gang of arms smugglers to Hazaribagh for delivery of a consignment to someone in Moradabad, said Singth. After reaching DDU Junction, they were waiting to borad a train to Moradabad.

The pistols, with ‘Made in US’ markings, but suspected to be country-made, were being sent to Moradabad from Hazaribagh in Jharkhand. The accused revealed that the gang earns a profit of Rs 35,000 on sale of each pistol. Teams of IB and anti-terror squad also interrogated the carriers while a GRP team was sent to Hazaribagh and Bokaro to trace kingpin of the gang.

Singh said it was the biggest haul of arms consignment and shared that his team his team had seized 69 pistols between 2017 and 2019. The arms smuggling gangs in Bihar and Jharkhand procure a pistol for Rs 15,000 and sell it for Rs 50,000 in west UP and Delhi, earning a profit of over Rs 35,000, he said.

Meanwhile, in Ballia, police busted an arms manufacturing unit in Ajaur village in Khejuri police station area and caught two arms manufacturers and smugglers, Santosh Kumar Singh and Chhotelal. Two country-made revolvers, barrels, other parts and equipment for making arms and live cartridges were also recovered. Inspector Khejuri, Pradeep Kumar Chawdhary said the accused confessed their involvment in manufacturing and smuggling arms.

Title: Judiciary also to blame for HC vacancies: Govt
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: It takes 337 days, or the better part of a year, on an average for appointment of a high court judge after a name is recommended by the HC collegium, attorney general K K Venugopal told the Supreme Court on Monday, arguing that the judiciary was equally responsible for 36% vacancies in HCs.

Detailing the timeline, Venugopal told a bench of Justices S K Kaul and K M Joseph, which is examining delays in appointment of HC judges, that on average the Centre took 127 days to decide on the list given by the HC and forward it to the SC collegium .

The collegium took 119 days to clear the names and the government thereafter took another 73 days to finalise the list which was then cleared by the Prime Minister and the President in 18 days. The break-up was based on the time taken for appointments in 2019.

Justifying the time taken by the Centre to forward the recommendations , the attorney general said the government had to collect information from state authorities and conduct an inquiry by the Intelligence Bureau before clearing names and asked why the SC collegium took almost the same time.

The sanctioned strength of judges in 25 HCs is 1,079 but the working strength, as on February 1, was 683. Some HCs like Patna and Rajasthan have more than 50% vacancies.

Venugopal said a major reason for huge vacancies was delay on part of HC collegiums in recommending names. As of now, no names have been forwarded by HCs for 199 out of 396 vacancies. He urged the SC to direct HCs to initiate the process of appointment one year before a vacancy arose and said explanation should be sought for delays. He told the bench that in many cases, HC collegiums sent recommendations more than five years after a vacancy arose.

Agreeing with the AG’s submission, the bench said, “Some introspection is required to be done on our part also and there has to be some administrative work mechanism... If we (judiciary) are not doing something, then we also need to push ourselves.”

It said the situation in some HCs was “alarming” and the chief justices of HCs must try to make recommendations as early as possible. Though the bench did not issue notice to HCs for delay in appointments, it directed registrar generals of HCs to file a report on vacancies or those likely to arise in the near future and when recommendations would be made by HCs for appointments.

As per the report filed by the AG, 80 proposals are pending with the SC collegium and 35 with the Centre. He said the SC collegium and the Centre were on the same page regarding 10 out of 35 proposals and there was a difference of opinion on 25 names.

Title: Bhim Army denied permission for protest at RSS’ doorstep
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: The Bhim Army has been refused permission to hold a karyakarta melava (workers’ meet) at Reshimbagh Ground, adjoining the RSS’ Dr Hedgewar Smruti Mandir, on February 22. The Reshimbagh Ground has been the traditional site for RSS functions, including the annual Vijaya Dashami event, held to mark the organization’s foundation day.

The Vijaya Dashami meet is addressed by RSS Sarsanghchalak (chief) each year. The ground belongs to Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT), and programmes can be held after securing the civic body’s approval and getting a police clearance. The Bhim Army’s application has been turned down by the police on the grounds that holding the event at Reshimbagh Ground can lead to a law and order situation.

The Bhim Army meet was supposed to be addressed by its chief Chandrashekhar Azad Ravan, who has been on the forefront in the anti-CAA-NRC movement, and was also barred from entering New Delhi.

The Bhim Army had secured approval from NIT, which was subject to police clearance, which was denied eventually. The programme has been organized in association with an outfit ‘We the citizens of India’, that had organized a series of anti-CAA-NRC agitations at Samvidhan Chowk in the city.

The RSS has been directly targeted during anti-CAA-NRC protests in the city, branding it as a fascist and pro-upper caste organization.

Bhim Army now plans to continue with its plans to hold the function at Reshimbagh, and court arrests after that, said its district chief Praful Shende, who had moved the application

Salman Ahmed of ‘We the people’ said the organization also plans to move court against denial of permission. Over 10,000 persons are estimated to turn up for the event, he said.

Shende, district chief of Bhim Army, said the ground was chosen because even the outfits’s office comes under the same area. “If we are not allowed to hold a function there, the police should also issue a list of organizations that should be barred from Reshimbagh,” he said.

Shende said, “The programme will be basically a membership drive. Pamphlets will be issued urging people to join Bhim Army and there will also be a mention about the organization’s stance on CAA and NRC. It also depends on what the speakers choose to talk about during the event,” he said.

Apart from Ravan, his lawyer Mohammed Pracha will also be one of the speakers, said Shinde.

An official at Kotwali police station, where the application for permission was put up, said the permission was denied because the Reshimbagh Grounds cannot be allotted for purposes like holding protests.

Title: After long delay, NMC set to hold hearings for tree felling
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: For the third consecutive time, the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has not taken the mandatory public hearing regarding objections against tree felling. Officials had said that hearings will soon be held in the city on the objections received against tree felling at Empress Van and for Smart City Project roads.

According to the Maharashtra (Urban Trees) Protection and Preservation of Trees Act which was passed by the state government in 1975 and amended in 2017, a public hearing on objections should be conducted and a decision be given within two weeks.

The act states, “If any objection is received against permission for tree felling, the matter shall be placed before the tree authority for reconsideration. A decision should be taken within two weeks after giving a hearing to the person who has raised objection.”

TOI had earlier reported that despite record-breaking objections against tree felling at Bharat Van, the civic body did not take any public hearing. Similar objections were filed opposing felling of hundreds of trees at Empress Van and recently for Smart City Project roads.

While activists are slamming the civic body for not holding the hearing, officials from NMC’s garden department said that it will soon be conducted. “We don’t need to hold a meeting for Bharat Van case as the authorities have dropped the plan to construct the road. However, we have received objections for Empress Van and Smart City and we plan to hold hearings for both the cases soon,” said NMC garden superintendent Amol Chorpagar.

Over 800 objections were filed to oppose the construction of road via Empress Mill land. Following a recent public announcement regarding chopping down of 139 trees for Smart City Project roads, people from different fields came together to submit objection letters. This was the third time when citizens filed mass objections against destruction of green cover.

Officials informed that apart from a few small-scale hearings, the civic body has not yet held a hearing based on mass objections.

As per the rules, NMC gives a public notice in local newspapers regarding permission giving for felling, even if a single tree is to be cut. Citizens have the right to object against any permission given to tree felling which are placed before the tree authority for reconsideration.

Apart from newspapers, NMC is now displaying similar information on its website too. “We are in the process of updating latest permissions on the official website,” said Chorpagar.

WHAT RULES SAY

Maharashtra (Urban Trees) Protection and Preservation of Trees Act states people can object against any permission given to tree felling

Objections to be placed before the tree authority for reconsideration

Public hearing should be conducted

Decision should be taken within two weeks

Title: 1,300 BSNL employees opt for VRS in Pune district
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

PUNE: Of the total 2,000 BSNL employees in the district, 1,300 have opted for the voluntary retirement scheme, which the Union government had launched in October last year as a part of the five-pronged revival package for the public telecom firm.

“We are functioning at slightly more than 25% staff, due to which some operational issues are being faced. However, we have already undertaken redistribution of staffers to streamline operations. All of the 38 customer service centres in Pune district are functional. We are also working on outsourcing certain tasks to improve services,” Sandeep Sawarkar , principle general manager, Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Pune, said.

Addressing a news conference in the city on Monday, Arvind Vadnerkar , director for human resources, BSNL Board, New Delhi, said, “With the voluntary retirement scheme (VRS), one step of the revival plan has been completed. Across the country, of the 1.49 lakh employees, 1.02 lakh were over 50 years of age and eligible for VRS. Out of this, 78,000 people opted for VRS across all classes of employees. Another 6,000 employees are between 59 years and 60 years and will retire soon. All this will bring down our spent on salaries by Rs 7,200 crore annually.”

Vadnerkar said the funds saved after the mass VRS would be diverted towards other schemes and issues. “The Centre had promised 4G spectrum for BSNL under the revival package. We will be allotted the spectrum in April this year and the 4G services will be available across the country by October. Money saved from salaries will be used towards the 4G infrastructure,” he said.

Speaking about non-payment of electricity bills of BSNL exchanges that led to disconnection of services to thousands of customers, Sawarkar said, “The funds saved from salaries will now be used to clear pending electricity bills and improving infrastructure.”

Vadnerkar also cleared the air pertaining to rumours about the government’s plan to sell the state-owned telecommunications provider. “The news of BSNL being sold off is only a rumour. Through the revival package, the government only wants to make BSNL a profitable and self-sustaining entity,” he added.

Title: Lawyers protest Justice Haq’s shifting with white bands
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: Over 500 lawyers participated in protests against sudden transfer of Justice Zaka Haq to Aurangabad bench terming it “humiliation” of entire legal fraternity in the city. They tied white bands on their coats in the first session till lunch. However, the protests also brought out faction fight within High Court Bar Association (HCBA) with some lawyers questioning whether Association’s consent was taken.

These differences led to war of words between protesters and HCBA office-bearers. The latter stated protests were organized by a “group of lawyers” in individual capacity and HCBA executive body had not consented for them. “We haven’t received any demand (for support) from them,” HCBA secretary Prafulla Khubalkar told TOI. He added the much-awaited HCBA polls would be held on April 3 and new body would be announced the same day.

Noted lawyer Shreerang Bhandarkar, who led the protests, questioned HCBA office-bearers’ role in denying support to protests while claiming that their term had ended on February 10 after completion of three years tenure. “The last HCBA polls were held on February 10, 2017. The current body is now defunct as per the HCBA constitution and, therefore, their consent is not required. It is not important on which date the body assumed charge, as they can take it even after a year. The rules are same like what happens in general and assembly elections where tenure is calculated from the date of actual polling,” he told TOI.

Another lawyer Adil Mirza said there was no provision for caretaker or ad hoc body in HCBA rules and, therefore, the current body led by president Gauri Venkatraman, vice-president Purushottam Patil and Khubalkar, was only in name.

Khubalkar on the other hand asserted that since the executive took charge on April 14, 2017, their tenure would end only after two months and till then, they would be functioning as full-fledged body with all powers. “We are working as per HCBA rule book, which says our tenure would commence from the day of assuming charge and not that of election date. How can they say that we’re defunct,” he asked. Asked for comment Venkatraman said she would call back but did not.

The protesting lawyers added they would continue their protests in same way after a break. “Next week, we plan to approach new chief justice with a request to stop Justice Haq’s transfer. The new incumbent would most probably be Justice Bhushan Dharmadhikari, who is currently the senior most judge in Mumbai after resignation of Justice Satyaranjan Dharmadhikari. With just a couple of months left for former’s retirement, he may get the top post like Justice Naresh Patil,” they told TOI.

Title: City to celebrate Mahashivratri from Feb 20-23
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Officials review preparations for Mahashivrati celebrations

Varanasi: Adding one more festival to the list of events hosted by Kashi tourism department every year, Mahashivratri Mahotsava will be celebrated for four days on a grand scale in the Shiva’s abode. The festival is falling on February 21 this year.

Tourism department, which spends over Rs one crore on Ganga Mahotsava and organises Budhwa Mangal, will spend around Rs 50 lakh on four-day Mahashivratri Mahotsava commencing from February 20. Apart from several cultural and literary events, boat-race and boat fest will remain prime attraction on the concluding day of the fest.

Talking to TOI on Monday, divisional commissioner Deepak Agrawal said, “Mahashivratri Mahotsava will be the third cultural fest, courtesy tourism department. This is being started from this year to make the pilgrims and tourists aware about the cultural heritage of the ancient old city. All the events of this mahotsava will be based on the legends of Lord Shiva.”

The tourism department has allocated a budget of Rs 50 lakh for this mahotsava, which is the second largest expenditure on any cultural fest after Ganga Mahotsava, he said adding, the department allocates budget of Rs one crore for Ganga Mahotsava out of which funds up to Rs 30 lakh are generated from sponsors. Ganga Mahotsava is organised between Prabodhini Ekadashi and Kartik Purnima in November. Another event of Budhwa Mangal is organised by the department after the festival of Holi with the help of sponsors instead of its own exchequer, said Agrawal.

Giving details of the Mahashivratri Mahotsava at a press conference, Agrawal said, “The cultural events of the fest will be organised at Rajghat along river Ganga from February 20 to 22. All events will take place in the evening.” On the inaugural day of the fest, he said, an all India poetry recital will be held after performances of Kathak and music.

Devotional music and Kathak events will be held on February 21 and 22, he said adding that a boat festival will be organised at Rajghat on February 23. Another attraction would be a boat race from Ravidas Ghat to Rajendra Prasad Ghat which will witness participation of 40 manually sailed boats, he said adding that cash prize of Rs 25,000, Rs 15,000 and Rs 10,000 will be given to the first, second and third winners of the race while every participant will be given Rs 2,000 each consolation prize.
