A total of 25 entries have been received for the race so far, he added.

A parade of hand-painted and decorated boats will be conducted in front of Rajendra Prasad Ghat, he said adding that the boat fest will conclude with cultural programmes on 20 ‘bajras’ (big size boats) having a capacity of accommodating 700 viewers.

Title: HC slams T, Inter Board over safety
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Coming down heavily on the state and the Intermediate board for allowing junior colleges that are allegedly running without fire clearances and other norms to walk away with mere penalties, the Telangana high court on Monday directed the Board to explain by February 27 the details of action it took against errant colleges.

The HC was hearing a PIL, which sought action against colleges like Narayana and Chaitanya, which are running colleges in several illegal buildings, while endangering the lives of students. Both corporate groups have 79 colleges each in greater Hyderabad and around 50 of them do not possess fire permissions. The HC found fault with the board for taking affidavits from them to the effect that it is extending permissions with penalties and an assurance. tnn

Title: Youth arrested for abetting suicide as girl ends life
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The Mhasrool police have arrested a 21-year-old youth on charges of abetting the suicide of an 18-year-old girl from the Mhasrool area.

The Mhasrool police said the youth was arrested following a complaint lodged by the girl’s father.

Investigating officer API Shivaji Ahire, of the Mhasrool police station, said the girl had committed suicide in August 2019. The girl had consumed poison and died while undergoing treatment at a private hospital.

The viscera of the deceased girl was preserved for further examination to ascertain the exact cause of death. The report arrived recently and revealed that she had consumed poison.

The girl’s father then lodged a complaint against the suspect, who is from the Gangawadi area of Makhmalabad. In his FIR, the father said the suspect often used to call up his daughter on her cellphone and harass/threaten her to marry him.

Frustrated with this constant harassment, the girl allegedly took the extreme step by consuming some poisonous substance. The girl was rushed to a private hospital after the incident came to notice, but she did not respond to the treatment and died.

The police said the girl had not left any suicide note behind. However, her father was aware that his daughter was being harassed by the youth.

API Ahire said the deceased girl and the suspect’s sister were friends. The suspect and the victim had met at a wedding ceremony after which he started harassing her to marry him.

The police said the girl’s father is a worker. The suspect also used to take up temporary jobs. Soon after the complaint was lodged, the police arrested the suspect on Monday.

Title: Jaisalmer: 13 Buddhist monks stopped from going to Pakistan
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

JOURNEY HALTS: According to officials, the monks didn’t have the required permission to cross over to the othe... Read More

JAISALMER: Thirteen Buddhist monks , who are on world march for peace and wanted to enter Pakistan via Munabao, have been detained by the Army for entering the prohibited area near the border on Sunday night.

The monks, reportedly, didn’t have the required permission to cross over to the other side of the border. They are now being questioned by the authorities.

According to sources, the monks came on foot came from Thailand via Myanmar and reached Barmer on Sunday. They wanted to go to Pakistan via Munabao, whereas the district administration and other agencies did not get any orders from the home ministry in this regard. There is possibility that these monks will be permitted to enter Pakistan from Wagah border in Punjab.

The delegation, which has 12 Thai citizens and a Canadian Buddhist monk, is on a mission to travel to France, covering over 10,000-km.

Led by Pa Sutham Nati Dhom Mang, the team had earlier travelled from Thailand to the USA, covering over 9,000-km on foot, in the first phase of their mission.

Gurupal Singh, DIG, Barmer Sector, BSF, said they have not received any order to let the delegation cross over to Pakistan via Munabao.

Barmer district collector Anshdeep said if the team wants to cross the border, then they will have to seek permission from the authorities concerned.

Title: City gets a glimpse of J Krishnamurti’s philosophy
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Visitors at exhibition organised by the Krishnamurti Foundation of India at Rajghat Education Centre on Monday

Varanasi: The Krishnamurti Study Centre at Rajghat, where the renowned thinker and spiritual teacher J Krishnamurti lived during his annual visits to Varanasi, witnessed a special musical presentation by students of Rajghat Besant School on Monday to mark the inauguration of three-day event —‘The First Step is the Last Step’ based on Krishnamurti’s philosophy.

The exhibition, curated by the Krishnamurti Foundation of India, has been organised as a part of the year-long celebration of 125th birth anniversary of Krishnamurti (May 11, 2019- May 11, 2020). After the premier at Chennai on February 1, the exhibition travelled to Varanasi.

During the exhibition, visitors got an opportunity to visit Krishnamurti’s library, see his audio and video recordings and his research materials. The centre has a reading room facing the river, a video room, a silence room, a dialogue room, and a bookshop where Krishnamurti’s teachings are available in English and Hindi.

The exhibition invites the viewer to engage with themes that Krishnamurti frequently spoke or wrote about - fear, love, violence, death, religion, relationship and education, said joint director of Rajghat Education Centre Kumar Radhakrishnan. He said that it was felt that endeavour should be made to introduce Krishnamurti’s vision to a wider audience. following which the foundation is plannimng to make his teachings available on various digital platforms.

The Rajghat Education Centre, comprising of Vasanta College for Women, Rajghat Besant School and Achyut Patwardhan Rural School was established 90 years ago. The centre also offers a research scholarship programme for those wishing to research any aspect of Krishnamurti’s teachings, said Radhakrishnan. Theme study retreats and video screenings of Krishnamurti’s talks and dialogues on human issues are held regularly here.

The exhibition will conclude on February 19 with the presentation of a film, ‘Kannati Bimbam’, a documentary on the traditional craft of mirror making by Harsha Vinay of Alice Bonner Institute.

Title: Cops to crack down on dealers selling fuel in cans
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik police have decided to step up action against petrol pump dealers selling fuel in cans or bottles.

Nashik city police commissioner Vishwas Nangare-Patil said they would issue a notice to all petrol pump dealers warning of strict legal action if the fuel is found to have been sold in the open.

At the same time, Nashik rural superintendent of police Arti Singh also said that she would be conducting a meeting of petrol and diesel dealers.

The rural police have decided to recommend suspension or cancellation of the petrol pump licence if the dealers concerned are found selling the fuel to customers in their bottles and cans.

On February 15, a 40-year-old woman from Lasalgaon sustained serious burns after she was accidentally set ablaze — during a scuffle with a youth with whom she was in a relationship. The woman had bought petrol in a bottle and kept in her two-wheeler.

The woman was carrying a can of petrol when the altercation took place.

The police have managed to get hold of the CCTV footage of the petrol pump from where she had bought the fuel before the incident.

In view of this incident, Singh said the rural police would issue strict instructions to the petrol pump dealers against selling the fuel in loose. “We have called a meeting of all petrol pump dealers and officials of the state owned oil marketing companies on Monday to instruct them about the hazards of selling the fuel in loose. If they are still found selling fuel on the loose, we will recommend suspension or cancellation of their licence.”

Nangare Patil said, “It is prohibited to sell diesel and petrol in bottles or cans. On the backdrop of the recent incident, we will issue a notice under section 144 of Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) to petrol pump dealers to do away with the practice of selling petrol or diesel in loose. There is a provision of legal action if instructions under section 144 of the CrPC are violated.”

Earlier this month, a 24-year-old woman lecturer of Hinganghat in Wardha district was allegedly set afire when she was on her way to college. She later succumbed to her injuries at a hospital in Nagpur on February 10.

Title: Customs nabs flyer carrying gold worth Rs 20 lakh in semi-solid paste form
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The customs officials with the recovered gold on Sunday

PUNE: Customs officials nabbed a woman carrying 642 gram of gold worth Rs 20 lakh in semi-solid paste form at the Lohegaon airport on Sunday.

The woman, identified as Mariyam Mohammed Salim Sheikh of Mumbai, was found carrying the gold carefully concealed inside three capsules in her rectum, Pune customs officials said.

“The woman was intercepted by the team on the basis of intelligence reports and inputs. She had come to Pune from Dubai on a SpiceJet flight (SG52), which landed at the Lohegaon airport at 4am on Sunday. After the due process and assistance of the medical team, the gold paste was found concealed in her rectum,” a customs official said.

The customs officials said the woman seemed to be a wilful carrier. “The three capsules were covered in black adhesive tape and contained gold in semi-solid paste. In total, 642g of gold worth Rs 20 lakh has been recovered from her,” the official said.

“Further investigations under the Customs Act 1962 is under progress in the case. We appeal all passengers to report to us of any suspicious person/s and baggage at the Pune airport . Body concealment of contraband material is the most risky, painful and fatal for the one carrying it. Though Pune has less direct international flights now, the alertness level is the same,” the official said.

In a similar recovery, the customs officials had arrested a man, a resident of Bhatkal in Karnataka , from the airport after he was found to be concealing gold in his rectum in May last year. “We had also caught a man who was trying to exit the Pune airport with gold hidden in his wig in May last year. He was trying to smuggle in 957.10 gram of gold worth Rs 31.13 lakh,” another customs official said.

In October 2018, the customs authorities had caught four African women, following which more than 2kg of gold worth Rs 66.50 lakh was recovered from them. These women, who hailed from Sudan, had also concealed the gold in their rectum.

“In the recent past, the smugglers have used the carriers and have devised different ways to hide gold. There is no definite trend when it comes to concealment and the tricks,” a source said.

Title: Activists, ex-TA men allege club house planned in Sitabuldi Fort
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: Activists and office bearers of Retired Territorial Army Personnel Association (RTAPA) staged a demonstration at Samvidhan Square on Monday, expressing apprehension that a club house is being planned inside the historical Sitabuldi Fort. They have demanded that the 118 Territorial Army (TA) should be brought back to the fort.

HQ Uttar Maharashtra and Gujarat Sub Area (UMANG), which took over possession of Sitabuldi Fort recently, has refuted the allegations and said they plan only to make available the mess, which already exists inside the fort, for ex-servicemen also.

Under the banner of Shivkalin Sitabuldi Qilla Bachao Samiti, activists led by chairman of Kisan Sewa Sangh Avinash Kakade and office bearers of RTAPA led by president Sukhdev Gadpayle and secretary Ramesh Kantekar staged a daylong demonstration. Activists Pramod Pande, Janardhan Moon, Mohnish Jabalpure, Dr Nayeem Khan etc also visited the agitation.

Following the directives of the defence ministry, the 80-year-old 118 TA had moved out of Sitabuldi Fort to Bhusawal last year. Now, UMANG, which was shifted from Mumbai to the city a year ago, has taken over possession of Sitabuldi Fort.

Kakade told TOI, “I have learnt that a club house with gym, auditorium etc has been planned inside Sitabuldi Fort. Messages are making the rounds among ex-TA personnel and ex-servicemen about the charges and facilities to be provided in Sitabuldi Fort. There seems to be some conspiracy behind moving out the 118 TA from city to Bhusawal. One of the ministers is also planning to make use of the Fort for various purposes. We will not allow the historical Sitabuldi Fort to lose it’s value.”

A message shown by Kakade to TOI mentions one-time subscription charges of Rs25,000, of which Rs5,000 will be security deposit. Monthly subscription will be Rs500. The message mentions the various types of facilities including bar and catering services.

Kakade added, “There is also a temple and dargah inside the fort. Everyone knows the significance of the fort for its long history and also visit of Mahatma Gandhi. The fort is also known for some martyrs. We will not tolerate a bar and other types of services inside it.”

Gadpayle too told TOI about his fears about a club house being planned inside the fort. “Shifting of 118 TA itself is a major setback for Vidarbha. 118 TA should be brought back at any cost. Vidarbha has lost a large number of jobs and a defence unit.”

Kakade said, “UMANG is a team with only 35 staffers and it has been given a fort spread over 100 acres. UMANG has been given an office and premises near RBI. There was no reason to hand over Sitabuldi Fort to UMANG. The city is blessed with offices and establishments of various defence sectors. Offices of all these like Air Force, Army, Ordnance Factory should be shifted to Sitabuldi Fort.”

Col Nikhil Deshpande of UMANG said, “All allegations levelled by activists are incorrect. We are not planning anything new inside the fort. There is a mess inside the fort. It is a common practice across the country that mess is made available also for ex-servicemen. Therefore, we are planning to permit mess for ex-servicemen. There is a gym at the mess which can also be used by ex-servicemen.”

Title: Rs10.61 cr to be paid as bonus to tendu collectors in region
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: Over 1.83 families in 7 forest circles of Vidarbha who were involved in collection of tendu leaves last season will get Rs10.61 crore as bonus .

Forest minister Sanjay Rathod approved the proposal submitted by APCCF (non-timber forest produce) in November. The minister has asked officials concerned to distribute the bonus to all beneficiaries at the hands of district guardian ministers before March-end.

The policy of distributing bonus to tendu leaf collectors was started in the year 2006 when it was decided to distribute the excess amount after deducting the administrative cost plus 12% as bonus. Since then it is continuing.

Tendu bonus is the most important earning source for poor tribals living in forest areas. For nearly two months they stay near forests to collect tendu patta. Entire families are involved in tendu collection to earn maximum wages as well as bonus amount.

“As per government approval on February 12, 2020, we have issued orders to make payment of bonus amount to the family head of tendu leave collectors by transferring amount to their account or through cheques to all eligible stakeholders,” said APCCF (NTFP) TK Choubey.

This amount is in addition to the collection wages which they get for actual tendu leaves collection from respective contractors. Till 2006, the entire amount earned from the sale of tendu leaves was pocketed by the state government.

However, as per the policy decision in 2006-2007, the government decided to pay bonus to the stakeholders from royalty amount after deducting administrative expenses.

In 2019, the state forest department received royalty worth Rs38.77 crore towards sale of 204 units from which 2.24 lakh standard bags of tendu leaves were collected.

Of the total royalty amount, Rs28.15 crore were deducted towards administrative expenses and remaining amount will be distributed to tendu collectors. The circles that will benefit include Nagpur, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Dhule, Yavatmal, Amravati and Aurangabad.

Title: Ram Gopal Varma approaches police for information on Disha case
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Ram Gopal Varma

HYDERABAD: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma , who is planning to make a film on the Disha rape and murder, on Monday approached the police for information on the case.

Though Varma was received at ACP Ashok Kumar Goud’s office, the filmmaker was not able to meet the ACP. “I was away and not at my office when he came. I was busy otherwise because of local elections,” ACP Goud said. Asked by TOI if the information sought by the filmmaker will be given to him, the ACP said: “That is beyond our purview.”

Varma had announced his intention of making a film on Disha, and has already met the wife of one of the accused Chennakeshavulu.

He said as part of the research he was doing on the case, he would like to meet police officers involved in handling the case.

“I came here today only to meet the ACP, but who I will meet next is something I will reveal only later,” he told reporters at the Shamshabad ACP’s office.

“I need not take anyone’s permission to make the film as it was a big issue, and I will bring the story to the screen considering that I am a filmmaker,” he said.

According to the family members of Chennakeshavulu, one of the accused who was also killed in the police encounter, Varma had suggested to them that when the pregnant wife of Chennakeshavlu delivers a baby, they should name the baby Disha.

“It is not agreeable to us,” a family member said, though Chennakeshavulu’s wife was said to have initially given a positive answer to the suggestion.

In a recent tweet, Varma had said: “My next film is titled “Disha’ which is going to be about the Disha rape. After the brutal rape and horrific murder of Nirbhaya, the Disha rapists went further in their ghastliness in actually burning the poor girl with petrol.” A 26-year-old veterinary doctor, whom the police named Disha, was gangraped and murder by four men in Shamshabad on November 27, 2019. Subsequently, the accused were arrested and killed in a police encounter on December 6, 2019.

Title: Chennai corporation planning 15 flyovers at busy junctions
Content:
Velachery intersection

CHENNAI: After a gap of two decades, Greater Chennai Corporation is laying the foundation to build flyovers at congested junctions.The corporation has submitted a proposal to the state government to build 15 grade separators at a cost of approximately `1,500 crore. The last time flyovers were built by the corporation was during the mayorship of M K Stalin, now DMK president.Corporation officials are observing the proceedings of the ongoing state assembly and hoping the government will give a green signal to the proposal.Government sources said it is likely that funds for grade separators, which do not involve land acquisition, may be initially sanctioned while the others will be taken up over the next few years.Senior corporation officials said Chennai has a lower ratio of flyover/grade separator to regular city roads in comparison to Mumbai, Kolkata and Delhi. This despite having the third highest two-wheeler population.Officials said the 15 locations were priority intersection points and were decided after a detailed study by a consultant. These are in Kilpauk, Basin Bridge, Velachery, RA Puram, Teynampet and Ayanavaram.The flyovers are expected to be short and the projects could be executed quickly at lesser cost. Integration with metro rail corridors has also been proposed. It is likely that like the Vadapalani flyover there may be multiple stacks of roads one above the other, to minimise land acquisition costs, an official said.According to the proposal, focus will be given on laying a 1.8m wide footpath beside the flyovers with well-designed approaches on the on-grade roads for better accessibility and safety.A senior official said congestion at signals leads to high emission of carbon dioxide and other polluting gases. “People living around the signal are affected by the pollution over a period of time. A flyover will ensure smoother traffic flow and bring down pollution levels,” theofficial said. This is similar to big cities in developed countries which offer reliable public transport as well as riding comfort for motorists with flyovers, he said.However, a transportation engineer working with the government said policy makers should work towards improving public transport instead of constructing flyovers to aid motorists.“In transportation engineering, it is believed that flyovers are a temporary solution as they transfer vehicles from one junction to another. The long-term solution should be to reduce vehicle registration and push citizens towards mass rapid transit systems like metro rail, suburban trains by subsidising such modes and construction of bus rapid transit systems,” the engineer said.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak prompts govt to sensitize students about safety measures
Content: Aurangabad: In the wake of the outbreak of novel coronavirus (COVD-19) in China and a few suspected as well as confirmed cases in India, the Centre has requested all institutions of higher learning to sensitize students about preventive interventions to keep the virus at bay.“Such informed youth can be agents of change for the family, community and beyond,” stated the letter from the ministry of health addressed to the education department.The Central authorities have also issued a special pamphlet carrying preventive measures.Emphasizing upon the preventive measures, the Centre has recommended frequent hand washing, using handkerchief, tissue paper or sleeve of the shirt covering the upper arm while coughing or sneezing, staying away from college when sick and avoiding public gatherings in order to prevent/ reduce transmission of communicable diseases, including flu.“You are requested to take up with the state education departments, universities and other autonomous teaching institutions under your ministry to sensitize their students these simple public health measures that will go a long way in preventing spread of novel coronavirus,” stated the letter written by Preeti Sudan, secretary of the Union health ministry directed to the ministry of human resource development (MHRD).Acting on the directives from the MHRD, the state directorate of technical education (DTE) has asked all recognized institutions to spread necessary awareness to curb the transmission of communicable diseases. “The central authorities have provided informatory pamphlets in English and Hindi. These self-explanatory documents can be posted on notice boards and other prominent places on the campus,” said officials from the DTE.Ulhas Shiurkar, principal of Deogiri Institute of Engineering and Management, said that the outbreak of coronavirus should be used as an opportunity to spread awareness on prevention of communicable diseases. “We have closely witnessed the outbreak of swine flu (H1N1) in the recent past. Now, our neighbor is battling with coronavirus. Students must know basics to prevent communicable diseases and colleges should take holistic measures to spread knowledge about the same,” said Shiurkar.The ministry of health has put out a helpline number +91-11-23978046 for any information related to coronavirus. The designated email id for seeking further information is isncov2019@gmail.com.

Title: Chennai Airport: 6.8kg meth valued at Rs 3.4 crore seized from warehouse at Chennai international airport
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The contraband has been sent to a lab for tests

CHENNAI: Customs officials posted at Chennai international airport on Sunday seized 6.8kg methaqualone worth Rs 3.4 crore from a warehouse in the city.

This is the second case in less than a week where the drug has been seized by central investigative agencies. On February 10, DRI officials made a seizure of 12.98kg of the contraband worth Rs 6.5 crore. In both cases, the drug was on its way to Australia.

On Sunday, customs officials received information that a parcel containing narcotics was likely to be smuggled out of the country through courier in the guise of apparel accessories. The courier intelligence unit of air customs detained one parcel at a courier warehouse in the city.

The consignor had declared the parcel to contain ribbon rolls and other apparel accessories. When examined, the parcel was found to contain items as per declaration but the ribbon rolls were unusually heavy. When the rolls were cut open, a hollow cavity was found inside each in which plastic pouches containing white crystalline powder was concealed. Fifty-seven such pouches were recovered from the rolls.

The powder was tested with narcotics testing kit and prima facie tested positive for methaqualone. A total of 6.815kg of white crystalline powder suspected to be methaqualone and valued at Rs. 3.4 crore was seized under the NDPS Act, 1985. The sample has been sent to laboratory for a confirmatory test.

The parcel was booked by a city-based person and was consigned to Australia. Searches were carried out at the address submitted by the consignor, but the address was fake. Efforts are being made to apprehend the consignor and to find the source of the seized drug, customs said.

Methaqualone is a central nervous depressant that acts as a sedative and hypnotic. The drug takes 30 minutes to kick in and its effects can last up to 8 hours. The drug was made famous in 70s by famous rock band Rolling Stones and also in the famous Hollywood movie ‘The Wolf of Wall Street’, customs said.

Title: 5 loot cash from bank’s customer service centre
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Varanasi: Five miscreants on two motorcycles decamped with cash worth Rs 1.50 lakh from customer service centre of Kashi Gomati Sanyukta Gramin Bank in Jamudi area of Mubarakpur police station area in Azamgarh district on Monday.

An exchange of fire took place between the miscreants and the centre operators but no one was injurd. SP Azamgarh Triveni Singh said that police have got important clues about the miscreants and they will be nabbed soon.

Mithilesh Dubey of Basgit village runs a customer service centre of the bank in Jamudi area. He was at the centre on Monday morning when five miscreants on two motorcycles raided the place.

They took Dubey on gunpoint and looted cash worth Rs 1.50 lakh from the centre. When they were leaving, Dubey opened fire on them with his licensed gun but the miscreants escaped and opened several round of fire in air in retaliation. Some local traders and natives also tried to chase the miscreants but failed.

DIG Azamgarh range Subhash Chandra Dubey, SP and other officials reached the incident site. After initial investigation SP said that several teams have been formed to workout the case at the earliest.

Title: Colleges warned of action for non-cooperation during exam
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Aurangabad: The Aurangabad division of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (MSBSHE) has warned colleges of stern action if they refuse to cooperate in conducting the HSC examination as per the schedule.

A section of colleges from the division had said it would boycott the HSC examination to press for their pending demands. In a statement issued a day before the start of HSC examination on Monday, the MSBSHE secretary Sugatha Punne has warned that colleges refusing to cooperate during the examination would lose their affiliation.

“A section of colleges had said they would not receive answer-sheets in order to protest the delay in accepting their demands. We would like to bring to the attention of such colleges that any act of non-cooperation that would affect the smooth conduct of the examination will draw stern action. The errant colleges would face de-recognition,” MSBSHE authorities said.

Converting permanently unaided institutions to aided ones and reintroducing old pension scheme are some of the major demands being raised by teaching and non-teaching staff from the unaided colleges.

Agitating teachers said that nearly 9,000 teachers have been affected due to an alleged arbitrary decision by the state education department to make Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) mandatory from retrospective effect.

“It is the state government which is expected to take policy decisions on different demands raised by college staffers. The role of MSBSHE is restricted to only conducting examinations and declaring results. We appeal to staffers not to hold students at ransom,” MSBSHE authorities said.

Title: Dist panel clears 4 cases, rejects 9
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The families of four farmers who had committed suicide have been found eligible for government aid, while the relatives of nine others were not as they had failed to meet the set criteria.

The district committee on farmers’ suicide reviewed a total of 16 suicide cases, out which a decision on four has been kept pending for further study.

District administration officials, however, said that the kin of the nine farmers can approach the government under the Gopinath Munde farmers’ insurance scheme, under which, the death of a farmer for any reason is compensated with Rs 2 lakh.

“The committee has unanimously rejected nine cases as they failed to meet the criteria laid down by the government of Maharashtra.

There are conditions such as financial burden and stress being the only reason for cause of suicide, repeated follow-up by financial institutions over dues and frequent crop failure etc,” said an official.

The family members of the four farmers — Suresh Nivrutti Vidhate (Pimpalgaon), Hemant Bhimrao Malode (Niphad taluka), Nawal Jairam Pawar (Ajmer Saindane, Baglan) and Tensign Mansing Magar will be entitled to get government aid. The government gives Rs 30,000 in cash and Rs 1 lakh is kept in the bank account as fixed deposit.

“The help given to the farmers by the government is too small. In fact Rs 30,000 is spent on the rituals by the family. While FD helps with some small steady income, the loan of the farmers remains to be paid,” Rajesh Shertate, a farmer, said.

Title: Home secy to probe CAG findings on police
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: With the recent CAG report making scathing remarks against the police, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan sought a detailed report from additional chief secretary (home and vigilance) Vishwas Mehta regarding the comments and findings of the report.

It is reliably learnt that Vijayan has asked Mehta to conduct an inquiry into all matters cited in CAG report and furnish a new report. Sources said state police chief Loknath Behera has sent an explanation to the home secretary, based on which Mehta will prepare his report.

However, a clause-by-clause explanation of the findings of CAG’s report will be given only before the public accounts committee of the assembly that will consider the report in detail as part of the legislative procedure.

CAG report had criticized the police on several matters. They are unauthorized purchase of bulletproof vehicles for VVIP security, shortage of weapons and live cartridges at state armed police battalion in the capital, procedural lapses in the procurement of vehicle-mounted GPS-based communication system, lapses in the procurement of voice-logger system, procedural lapses in the procurement of security equipment for Sabarimala and irregularity in the construction of villas for DGP and ADGPs using the funds for quarters for subordinate officers.

Though the police had offered its justification for the findings of the audit team, the latter hadn’t agreed with the arguments of the police; resulting in the final report carrying highly critical remarks in these matters.

The police top brass is of the view that though the performance audit had incisively pointed out some of the procedural errors on the part of the department and suggested adopting the best possible actions in the matters of financial dealings, it was critical of the police wherever a minor lacuna was revealed. The general sentiments within the force is that the audit had omitted some crucial aspects of police performance such as modernization and law and order while conducting the actual evaluation of the performance of the police department.

The police leadership is learnt to have explained to the government that deviations from the modernization of police force scheme guidelines, if any, was based on the contingencies and realistic evaluation of department requirements. The scheme guidelines are always taken as the prime reference, though at times absolute adherence to the same may not have occurred, the police explained to the government.

Title: EPS thinks he is on a par with MGR and Jayalalithaa: K C Palanisamy
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Edappadi K Palaniswami

Title: Arvind Kejriwal: CM won’t hold any portfolio, Jain gets water
Content:
Satyendar Jain with Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: In his third term as chief minister of Delhi, Arvind Kejriwal will not keep any department with himself. Allotting portfolios to his council of ministers on Monday, Kejriwal gave the charge of water — which he had directly handled for over two years in the previous term — to health minister Satyendar Jain .Most ministers will continue to hold the charge of the departments they headed in the previous term with one or two cosmetic changes made to balance the work. The changes include giving charge of the department of environment, forest and wildlife to Gopal Rai and women and child development to Rajendra Pal Gautam.According to a government statement, Kejriwal will now directly oversee the work of all ministers. “He will monitor all operational processes and functioning of all departments. He will also ensure interactions with the public to resolve the grievances and induce communication between his government and the public,” the statement read.Kejriwal headed the water department as chairperson of Delhi Jal Board in the first term of AAP government, which lasted just 49 days. After re-election in February 2015, he did not keep any department with himself. However, half-way into the term, Kejriwal took over DJB in September 2017, making it the first and only portfolio for him since AAP formed its second government.With laying down of water pipelines in all unauthorised colonies and supply of 24-hour clean water to every household being government’s top priority, Kejriwal has shown faith in Jain, who launched the flagship mohalla clinic scheme, started free medicines and pathological and diagnostic tests, and expedited the construction of classrooms in government schools in last five years.Environment is also among the key departments that AAP government will focus on. In its 10-point guarantee card, Kejriwal government has set the target of reducing air pollution by a third, cleaning up Yamuna and planting of over 2 crore saplings to make Delhi a “green city”.Rai, in the previous term, held relatively light portfolios, such as labour, development and employment. Sources confirmed that Kejriwal had handed over a huge responsibility to Rai by giving him the charge of environment, forest and wildlife departments.The charge of environment department was initially given to Imran Hussain, but later handed over to Kailash Gahlot in July last year. With Delhi’s air pollution level hovering around the “severe” level, especially in winter, it will be a challenge for Rai to take effective steps to fulfil the promise made in the guarantee card.Another change made by the chief minister is giving the charge of women and child development to Gautam. The portfolio was held by deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia between 2015 and 2020. “The portfolio of WCD is generally held by the same minister who looks after the social welfare department. Since Manish ji is already overburdened, the CM probably felt it appropriate to give the charge of WCD to Gautam ji,” a source said.Sisodia will look after education, finance, planning, land and building, vigilance, services, tourism, art, culture and language and all other departments not specifically allocated to any minister. Rai will now look after the departments of employment, development, labour and general administration department, environment, forest and wildlife, while Jain will hold the portfolio of the key departments of health, industries, Public Works Department, power, home, urban development and irrigation and flood control.Imran Hussain will handle food and supply and election departments of Kejriwal-led Delhi government.

Title: GHMC slashes playground user fee to promote sports
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Students during a sports session at GHMC grounds in Ameerpet

HYDERABAD: In what could benefit city schools immensely, GHMC has decided to slash user fee charges of playgrounds , sports complexes and indoor stadia owned by it. For instance, the fee has been cut down to Rs 40,000 for a playground spread over a 1,000 square metres from Rs 60,000 previously. The playground can be used for six days (150 hours).

Not just schools, even individuals and corporations can take advantage of GHMC’s largess as rates of weekend slots have also been reduced. In the new tariff regime, a playground for half a day can be booked by shelling out Rs 4,000. Earlier, Rs 6,000 fee used to be charged. Also, if one wants the ground for the entire day, GHMC will take Rs 7,500 towards user fee charges, which used to be Rs 11,000.

While GHMC believes this would promote sporting activity across the city, senior officials said specific time slots have been allotted solely for schools to use the playgrounds. “A majority of the schools utilise these grounds during the academic calender — between June and March,” a senior official explained.

The GHMC standing committee had already approved the proposal. “It will be passed by the council soon,” the official said.

Officials said schools which lack playgrounds stand to gain from GHMC’s offer. Normally, these schools book the nearest GHMC playgrounds so that the students can play and promote sporting activities.

In addition to the booking fee for grounds, the monthly membership fee for specific sports has also been reduced. For instance, swimming was charged at Rs 1,500 per month. The new tariff has been revised to Rs 1,000. Similarly, for shuttle badminton, the fee has been cut to Rs 500 per month from Rs 750.

Title: Panchavati Exp gets modified & comfortable LHB coach
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The Manmad-Mumbai-Manmad Panchavati Express has got one modified LHB coach providing much needed relief to the daily commuters.

The modified LHB coach, constructed by Modern Coach Factory in Raebareli, has all the facilities that the passengers have been demanding.

“The Linke Hoffman Busch (LHB) coaches are the safest, but those manufactured at the Integrated Coach Factory (ICF) were uncomfortable. The new coach is the best and we want the Central Railway to install more such coaches,” Kiran Borse, a regular commuter, said.

The problem with old LHB coaches — introduced in the year 2018 — was that they were uncomfortable for sitting. “Every day we had to travel in the same manner and that was taking a toll on our backs. The leg space between two seats was also less making it difficult for us to sit,” Keshav Marathe, another traveler, said.

The windows were also were placed in unplanned manner that affected the aeration in the coach. “The new LHB coach installed in the train (D5) is comfortable and has more windows aligned to the seats, better aeration and most importantly there are facing seats with better ergonomic and more leg room,” Vaishali Kulkarni, another regular traveler, said.

There are no bucket seats and since they are facing each other there is remarkable rise in leg space adding to the comforts. A railway official from Manmad said they had received the coach from Mumbai as replacement and that has also given us an opportunity to check its feasibility with the passengers on this route.

“Panchavati Express is likely to get a new rake in the next five months. But at this point in time we have got this coach and looking at the feedback we are likely retain the same here,” the officer said.

Another senior official from Bhusawal said the engineering department had carried out certain changes in the LHB coaches of Panchavati Express that were appreciated by the passengers.

Title: Torrent Group’s market cap crosses 50k crore
Content: Ahmedabad: Riding high on bullish investor sentiment aided by strong financial performance, Torrent Group’s market capitalization has breached Rs 50,000 crore mark to reach a record high levels. With their share prices soaring, the combined m-cap of Torrent Pharmaceuticals Ltd and Torrent Power Ltd — the two listed companies of Torrent Group — currently stands at Rs 51,199 crore.Separately, Torrent Pharma’s market cap was Rs 35,745 crore as on Friday, when its share price scaled a lifetime high of Rs 2,119.20 before ending the day at Rs 2,112.30. Torrent Power’s stock, too, touched a yearly high of Rs 332.50 on Thursday. The share ended the week at Rs 321.55 with m-cap of Rs 15,454 crore.“Both the companies are very well managed with strong financials. The next generation that has joined the company is working in a well-defined manner,” said Nilesh Kotak, a city-based stock analyst.Torrent Pharma has benefited from its continued focus on India, Brazil and Germany markets and synergies with the acquired business of Unichem. “The company’s solid India franchise, robust earnings growth and superior return profile justifies its premium over the industry peers,” said Devarsh Vakil, head advisory, PCG, HDFC Securities.According to him, Torrent Pharma’s business in India is expected to post a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 11% over the next three years. The Brazil business is seen growing at 10% CAGR during the same period.“Torrent Power is focused more on distribution of electricity rather than on its generation. Its margins are increasing as the company is currently getting power at a lower cost. The recently announced general budget’s focus on power distribution augurs well for the company,” said Kotak.The stock analysts opine that Torrent Power’s distribution business is doing well on all operational parameters and the outlook for the company’s gas-based power generation capacity is positive. The company remains very well capitalized, has low debt-equity ratio and consequently there has been an improvement in the credit rating of the company in a very difficult external environment.

Title: Coronavirus vaccine in the works, human trials likely to begin within six months
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Pune: A candidate vaccine is ready for pre-clinical trials, and possibly even human trials within six months, as part of the collaboration by Pune-based Serum Institute of India (SII) and American biotechnology firm Codagenix to develop a preventive vaccine against the novel coronavirus (COVID-19).

While efforts to find a coronavirus vaccine have already started globally, the SII-Codagenix candidate vaccine, developed using a laboratory-made synthetic virus, is an important breakthrough because it could significantly reduce the time taken to build a shield against the virus at the heart of the current outbreak emanating from China.

“Conventional approaches usually take seven to eight years to fully develop a vaccine for use. We have already marched ahead by generating a candidate vaccine in the laboratory of our US-based partner Codagenix. Our vaccine-virus strain is identical to the original virus and can generate a robust immune response,” industrialist Adar Poonawalla, owner and CEO of SII, told TOI in an exclusive interview on Monday.

“We will be ready for human trials within six months, which makes it the fastest ‘Made in India’ vaccine to enter this phase. Thereafter, it all depends on the regulatory clearance from the Union health ministry. Human studies will take another year. We hope to be ready with the vaccine by early 2022. This shows India’s capability to respond to a global pandemic in real time,” Poonawalla said.

When contacted, senior scientist R R Gangakhedkar, chief of epidemiology at the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), told TOI, “The approach is exciting in principle. It will be wonderful if it works. But it will have to go through elaborate laboratory and animal studies before being tested in human clinical trials. Using this method, they (SII) may also go closer to produce a generic influenza vaccine as against the current cocktail of three strains.”

The SII-Codagenix project will cost Rs 250-300 crore and vaccine major SII plans to secure external funding through its multiple international partners. “In a month’s time, we will enter into animal studies. By August-end, we will have data on mice and primates to submit to regulatory authorities to enter into the human trials phase,” Poonawalla said. “We are in talks with a number of firms across the globe for potential partnerships. We are also not excluding China as a potential site for our clinical trials.”

Poonawalla, who is also president of the Indian Vaccine Manufacturers’ Association, “Our live-attenuated vaccine against the novel coronavirus is just another demonstration of Indian vaccine industries’ capabilities of developing new and innovative vaccines required globally. Vaccines against typhoid, rotavirus and pneumococcal infections launched recently by Indian firms, including Bharat Biotech, Biological E and SII, have already made an impact worldwide.”

Title: Helpline started for HSC students
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Aurangabad: The Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (MSBSHE) has announced division-wise helpline for students appearing for theory examinations of HSC, from Tuesday.

A total of 15,05,027 students, including over 1.78 lakh from the Aurangabad division has registered for HSC examination. As per the official schedule, the theory papers are scheduled to take place from February 18 to March 18.

“The time-table of the examination was published on the state board official website on November 18 last year and it should be only considered as authentic. Flying and sitting squads will be in place during the examination in order to keep a check on unethical practices,” an official release said.

Keeping in mind with the recent practice, candidates are requested to report at the examination hall half an hour before the start of the examination. The distribution of question paper will take place 10 minutes prior to the start of the examination. Stating that ample time-gap has been given in between two successive papers, the MSBSHE authorities have appealed the students to face the examination with a calm mind and a positive approach.

Among other instructions, the state board has asked students to use only a simple calculator for designated subjects. Scientific calculator or calculator from a mobile phone will not be allowed during the examination, the release said.

The February-March 2020 examination will be having revised pattern for Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Biology, and Statistics (Arts and Science streams).

Aurangabad division of MSBSHE has five districts namely Aurangabad, Beed, Jalna, Parbhani and Hingoli while Latur division covers Latur, Osmanabad and Nanded districts.

Students from the Aurangabad division can contact 0240-2334228, 2334284, 2331116 in case of any difficulties related to the examinations. For the Latur division of the MSBSHE, the helpline number is 02382-2511733. Besides, the MSBSHE will be also operating a state-level helpline for students which can be accessed on 020-25705271, 25705272, an official release said.

Title: A month on, AU yet to name members for VC search panel
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Wait on

Allahabad: It has been almost a month since the Union ministry of human resource development (MHRD) asked Allahabad University authorities to nominate two persons to the search committee for the new vice-chancellor but the varsity is yet to call the meeting of its executive council (EC).

The university’s EC will finalise two members to the committee who will be joined by the third member to be nominated by the President (in capacity of Visitor of AU ).

As per norms, AU has to select the new vice-chancellor within 90 days from publishing of the advertisement of the post, that is, April 19. AU had published advertisement for the post of VC on January 20 and a deadline of one month was given to aspirants to file their applications.

As per the practice, MHRD instructs the university concerned to nominate two members for the search committee. Later, another member, nominated by the Visitor (President of the country), is added to the search committee. This team scrutinizes the names of applicants who apply for the post.

After scrutiny and direct interaction with applicants, whose number is decided by the search committee, the names are forwarded to the Visitor who takes the final decision. According to sources, AU will hold a meeting of the Academic Council (AC) in the first week of March and that of Executive Council after Holi. It is a common practice that AC’s meeting is held on the campus and its minutes are tabled in EC meeting for approval.

The Academic Council meeting is also important as it will decide the fate of the students of Ewing Christian College (ECC) who will be provided degrees from AU in future. After the AC meeting, the executive council will decide the names of two members to be nominated to the search committee. AU spokesman Shailendra Mishra said, “AU has to nominate two names for the search committee and the EC meeting will be convened to take a decision on the issue.”

Title: Brewery owner, aide arrested for murder
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Rajkot: Owner of a country made liquor brewery and his aide were arrested on Sunday night for allegedly murdering a 32-year-old drunkard man over the issue of payment for liquor in Urban Health Sector in Junagadh on Saturday evening.

Police said the accused, identified as Sagar Rathod and Rahul Vala, had allegedly killed Vijay Ghughal with sticks.

During their interrogation, Rathod and Vala told the cops that Ghughal used to visit the brewery daily and would not pay for the liquor he consumed. On Saturday, when he refused to pay, they beat him up with sticks.

“When Ghughal fell unconscious due to the beating, the accused laid him on the verandah and threw a bucket full of water on him. However, when he did not come around, they called up Ghughal’s uncle Amu. Amu took Ghughal’s father Heera to the spot where the accused told them that Ghughal was rendered unconscious due to heavy drinking,” said Pradeepsinh Jadeja, Junagadh deputy superintendent of police.

When the postmortem revealed that Ghughal had succumbed to injuries that he had suffered from beating, the police rounded up Rathod and Vala, as they were the prime suspects. During their questioning, the duo confessed to their crime.

Title: Dehradun: E-rickshaw owners call off protest
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

DEHRADUN: E-rickshaw owners on Sunday called off their 30-day-long protest here on Monday after police allowed the vehicles to ply on three major routes in the city, which had previously been banned.

President of Dehradun E-rickshaw Association Maroof Alam told TOI “After SSP Arun Mohan Joshi allowed us to ply our vehicles on three major routes, which were earlier banned by police, we decided to call off the protest. However, some e-rickshaw owners insist on continuing the protest till all the routes are opened.”

“Congress president Pritam Singh and vice-president Suryakant Dhasmana visited us protesters on Monday and requested to call off the protest, in the interest of commuters,” Alam added.

Title: Six killed after van hits truck in Haryana’s Hisar
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

HISAR: Six people were killed and as many injured when their van rammed into a stationary truck in Haryana's Hisar district on Monday, police said.

The victims were returning after attending a marriage function, they said.

The dead included the driver of the van, which hit a truck parked on a roadside between village Rakhi Garhi and Kheri Chaupta, on the Narnaund-Uchana road, about 30 km from here.

The victims were identified as driver Dinesh (34) of village Milkpur (Hisar), Sachin (19), Kuldeep (28), Om Prakash (49), Sohan Lal (65), all residents of Silewala village in Hanumangarh (Rajasthan) and Bhupender Singh (30), resident of Talwara village in Hanumangarh (Rajasthan).

According to police, a marriage party had come from Chooli Khurd village in Hisar to Milkpur. Most of the members had returned in the night but around 12 people were left.

On Monday morning, they hired the van and left for Chooli Khurd village. The injured Rohtash, Shravan Kumar, Kuldeep, Jatin, Abhishek and Vikram were admitted to Hansi civil hospital, police said.

Narnaund police are investigating the cause of the accident. The bodies have been sent to Hansi Civil Hospital for postmortem, police said.

Title: DMK moves court seeking probe into TNPSC scam
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Chennai: Alleging involvement of higher officials of TNPSC (Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission) including its chairperson in the recent recruitment to group 2 and group 4 services, the DMK on Monday approached the Madras high court seeking a CBI investigation.

“Huge sharks who are involved in this scam are let go free, while lower-level TNPSC officials are arrested and remanded. Without the involvement of TNPSC’s controller of exams, secretary and chairperson including the printers (who print the answer and question sheets) who are located outside the state, such a huge scam would have not happened,” said P Wilson, senior counsel representing the DMK.

Wilson made the submissions on a plea moved by Swapna, a transsexual candidate alleging irregularities in the recruitment to group 1 service in 2015. When the plea came up for hearing before a division bench of Justice R Subbaiah and Justice R Pongiappan, the senior counsel submitted that such scams have shocked the conscience of public and that the present plea has become a public interest litigation. He wanted the court to permit, DMK’s organising secretary R S Bharathi to implead in the case. Permitting to implead, the bench adjourned the hearing to February 28.

Wilson submitted that three investigating officers probing the scam have been changed and authorities are attempting to change the fourth officer as well to file a favourable report. “One of remand reports filed by IO (investigating officer) shows a telephone conversation by Sam Rajeswaran, another kingpin of Apollo Institute, with exam paper setters and correctors of answer sheets. The telephone log connects Manithaneyam Trust. Till now, neither of them has been arrested” Wilson said.

Title: Walkathon for women to be held in city
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The fourth edition of Women Walkathon 2020 for 3km will be conducted on March 1 in the city.

The initiative has been taken to emphasize on the importance of walking for health purposes among women.

The event will begin at 6.30 am from Suyojit Viridian Vallis, Savarkar Nagar. The theme of this year’s Women Walkathon is Me Fit = Family Fit.

The organisers have included a new category of “Mother and Baby Walk” where women can get their children up to the age of 5. Expecting women can also participate in the event.

“For safety purposes, we have arranged for two ambulances with doctors and nurses available ,” said Sonali Dabak, the organiser of the event

There will be six judges in the panel. Prizes will be distributed for the best poster, best slogan, best attire, best group, and many others. All the participants will be given a medal for their completion of the walk.

“This is a unique event in the city which has received a great response from the women in Nashik,” said Dabak.

Title: IAF chief to attend CAC meet today
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Allahabad: Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh Bhadauria will visit Allahabad on Tuesday.

Defence public relations officer (PRO) Wing Commander Shailendra Pandey said the IAF chief will attend the CAC Commanders’ Conference hosted by Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief (AOC-in-C), Central Air Command, Air Marshal Rajesh Kumar.

The IAF chief will be accompanied by his wife and president of Air Force Wives Welfare Association (AFWWA) Asha Bhadauria.

The conference will be attended by the commanders of all air force stations within the jurisdiction of CAC. The aim of the conference is to provide a forum to commanders to exchange views on operation, maintenance and administrative matters requiring deliberations with senior officials at the command headquarters.

The Air Chief Marshal was commissioned in the fighter stream of IAF on June 15, 1980. An alumnus of National Defence Academy (NDA), he graduated from the Air Force Academy with the coveted ‘Sword of Honour’.

The Air Chief will address all air warriors and civilian employees of CAC headquarters on his vision for IAF.

AFWWA president Asha Bhadauria will interact with regional president of the association Jaya Kumar and preside over the board of management meeting. She will review various welfare measures undertaken for the benefit of ‘Sanginis’ and their family members to improve the quality of life.

Title: Water literacy campaign launched
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Industry body Telangana Information Technology Association (TITA) has now embarked on a water literacy campaign that aims at bringing awareness about water, its use, conservation and effective management. The campaign was inaugurated on Monday at Basar in Nirmal district.

The curriculum for the awareness programme will be designed by Water and Land Management Training and Research Institute (Walamtari) and Rajendra Singh, touted as the waterman of India and a Raman Magsaysay Award winner, will support the programme.

Launching the campaign, Singh said, “Water conservation is the responsibility of all stakeholders including farmers, students and the general public. Basar is already known to be a 100% digital literate village and the same spirit will be required for the water literacy campaign.”

The campaign is to cover a population of about 8,000 in Basar, said TITA founder and global president Sundeep Kumar Makthala.

Title: Allahabad high court defers hearing on plea against cops’ action till March 18
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: The Allahabad high court on Monday adjourned the hearing till March 18 on a PIL petition filed against alleged police atrocities during anti-CAA protests in the state in December last year.

Hearing a bunch of petitions, a division bench comprising Chief Justice Govind Mathur and Justice Siddhartha Verma asked the petitioners and the state government to file their respective affidavits and relevant documents.

Earlier, at one stage, the court directed the state government to file affidavit and inform it about the FIRs/complaints filed by groups or organisations alleging police atrocities on protestors during anti-CAA protests.

Appearing on behalf of the state government, additional advocate general Manish Goel on Monday produced report regarding the incidents and informed the court that during protests on December 20-21, a total of 22 people had died and 83 sustained injuries. At least 45 police personnnel also received injuries, he said, adding that FIRs had been lodged against 883 people for rioting and damage to public property.

“Out of these, 561 people have been granted bail. Out of remaining 332, bail applications of 111 people are pending in different courts. Total 10 complaints were received against police which are being examined,” he said.

Petitioners’ counsel SFA Naqvi alleged excessive force was used by police which led to several deaths and injuries to many others. “Police action was unjustified and in violation of fundamental rights of protestors,” he added

.

Title: Metro starts feeder service from Khapri
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

A Metro spokesperson said that the agency had signed agreements with sixteen companies for starting feeder ser... Read More

Nagpur: MahaMetro has launched feeder services from Khapri station for those working in Mihan. The feeder vehicles include e-autorickshaw, low speed e-scooter, e-rickshaw, e-bicycle, LPG autorickshaw etc.

A Metro spokesperson said that the agency had signed agreements with sixteen companies for starting feeder services. These include Kinetic Green, KHS Associates, Patni Automobiles, Ride E, Bounce, Bharat Vikas Parishad, etc. He further said that feeder services would be launched at other stations soon.

According to Metro, IT professionals working in Mihan can commute from the city to their offices using the Metro and then use the feeder vehicles to reach their offices from Khapri station.

“Other than IT companies, Lupin Pharmaceuticals, Hexaware, Global Logic, AFC and other companies also have their units in Mihan. Their employees should also use the Metro and our feeder vehicles,” said the spokesperson. The feeder vehicles will be made available at the station in a phased manner.

Title: Roorkee: Harasser kills victim’s brother, 3 arrested
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative Image

ROORKEE: Roorkee Police on Sunday arrested three men, two of them siblings, for allegedly killing a 30-year-old man. The deceased’s mother alleged that one of the men used to stalk and harass her daughter , which led to a tension between her family and theirs. Both the deceased and the accused are residents of Saharanpur district in UP.

According to police, brothers Amit and Manish, along with their friend Ankit, took the victim to Telpura village near Buggawala from Saharanpur on Friday in a car. There they threw him off a motor bridge, into a river.

Providing details of the matter, SP (rural) Swapn Kishore Singh said, “Police on Saturday recovered a body from a local river in Telpura village of Buggawala police station. A driving licence recovered from the deceased revealed the identity of the victim. When we contacted the family of the deceased, his mother said she suspected one of her neighbours of killing her son. She informed police that the neighbour, Amit used to stalk her daughter.”

During interrogation, Amit confessed to hatching a plan to kill the brother of the woman he used to stalk. “We have arrested all three accused and recovered the car used in the crime as well as the mobile phone of the victim,” added Singh.

Title: Comic convention captures their imagination
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Comic Otaku Superhero Convention was held at Bhat Hall in Reshimbagh on Monday

Nagpur: Every anime lover’s fascination is to become a super hero. Though not technically possible, participants at Otakus (Japanese anime/manga lovers) were seen in colourful attire, wigs and accessories resembling like their favourite anime character at the Comic Otaku Superhero Convention at Suresh Bhatt Hall in Reshimbagh on Monday.

Organized by members of Nagpur Anime Club (NAC), the event was first held in 2015 and the second time in 2017. “This time we wanted to make it bigger and better. We had participants coming all the way from Mumbai and Meghalaya to give the event their best shot,” said Samarth Thakral, organizer and founder of NAC.

Such conventions are regularly held in metros and hence, two youngsters, Samarth and Tanmay Atte jointly organized this convention in the city.

“The idea is to get out of reality, to be someone you are not and get to be your favourite superhero. Many are not fortunate enough to go to Japan, so why not bring Japan here,” believes Atte.

The event had national and international guests like Sonal Kaushal (voice of doraemon), Vaibhav Lal (founder of vkaao) and Megumu Ishiguro san (production supervisor for Ramayana anime.

The Cosplay duo competition was the highlight of the festival. It is a practice of dressing up as a character from a film, book or video game, especially one from the Japanese genres of manga or anime.

Apart from the competition, there were other amazing events like the quiz competition based on the Netflix series and Japanese karaoke.

This coscon drew inspiration from the Japanese festival of Natsumatsuri. Big Japanese cultural organizations like Japan Foundation, JNTO and consulate general of Japan (Mumbai) were the event supporters.

The winner of Pop Culture Hiroshima (India qualifiers) held at COSCON Nagpur was Team Abyssal Scar (Donald Khumlo and Garry Nelson Syiem). Their cosplay performance as Gilgamesh and Berserker (Fate Zero) was truly amazing, drawing applause from both the audience as well as the judges. It was an exciting daylong event filled with excitement and enthusiasm.

Title: Parents want more pratice exams to help students sail through finals
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: At a time when students of private junior colleges are made to write series of tests as part of their board examination preparation, those studying in government colleges hardly got any practice as they appeared for only two pre-final examinations.

While one of the pre-finals was conducted in the month of January, the other exam is scheduled to be held after practical examinations.

“The syllabus was completed only in December. So, there was hardly any time to conduct more practice examinations,” said KS Rama Rao, Telangana Government Junior Colleges Principals association. He said that major part of February was dedicated for practical examination.

“After February 20, we are planning to conduct second and pre-final examinations,” he added.

Parents said that it would have been better if students get more practice before appearing for the board examination.

“Ideally, they should have conducted chapter wise tests for intermediate students also. Apart from giving them required practice, students would have also known important questions from each chapter,” said M Veerabhadra Rao, whose daughter is studying in intermediate first year.

While corporate colleges are conducting weekly tests to ensure that students are exam ready, private colleges too are conducting unit wise tests apart from pre-finals.

“Unit wise tests are conducted by almost every private college managements in the state. On average, students are made to write at least three pre-final examinations. To ensure students get enough time for rectifying errors they made in an exam, a gap of at least 15 days is given in between exams,” said G Satish, honorary president, Telangana Private Intermediate Colleges Association.

The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Officials (TSBIE), meanwhile, said that although they indeed lost few working days because of RTC strike, it has no impact on preparation exams. They said that every year they officially conduct only two pre-final exams and it is up to respective college principals and lecturers to conduct more examinations, if required. They said that apart from pre-finals, they also conducted four unit tests, quarterly, and half-yearly examinations.

Title: Dehradun: Ganga Kayaking Festival kicks off in Devprayag
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The festival is seeing participation of over 50 athletes including those from countries like Australia and Rus... Read More

DEHRADUN: The eight edition of the Ganga Kayaking Festival was inaugurated at Devprayag in Tehri Garhwal on Monday. The festival, jointly organised by Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board and The Adventure Sports Society is seeing participation of over 50 athletes including those from countries like Australia and Russia.

In the first day’s event, in the male sprint category, India’s Ayodhya Prasad bagged the first spot followed by Nepal’s Man Bahadur Kandel and India’s Rishi Rana. In the female sprint category, Australian and Russian kayakers dominated the show with Elizabeth Heath of Australia bagging the first spot followed by Russia’s Ekaterina and Anna.

Secretary (tourism) Dilip Jawalkar said that events like the kayaking festival help in encouraging the youth to take up adventure sports activities besides providing a boost to those whose livelihoods are connected with adventure sports. “There is a lot of potential in Uttarakhand as far as adventure sports activities are concerned. We in the tourism department are committed to encouraging and organising more such events in the future,” the secretary said.

Title: Rajasthan: Cow vigilantes allegedly attack two for transporting cattle
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

ALWAR/JAIPUR: Cow vigilantes allegedly struck again in Alwar district near Haryana border on Monday. Around 5am, the police found two injured persons in a mini truck that had rammed into a house in Govindgarh area of the district. On searching, the police found two calves and three cows in the mini truck. The two injured were immediately rushed to Alwar’s district hospital. The two calves died in the accident and their post-mortem has been conducted.

Later, the injured people’s families complained that the two had been beaten up by a mob. The accident occurred while they were trying to escape the mob. However, the police ignored their complaint and instead registered an FIR against the two injured for cow smuggling under Rajasthan Bovine Act.

“Prima facie it does not look like a case of mob lynching. We have not found any receipt from them for purchase of the bovines. A case has been registered against them under Rajasthan Bovine Act for cow smuggling. They met with an accident in the morning while transporting cows. We have admitted them to the hospital,” Deepak Kumar, assistant commissioner of police, Alwar (south) told TOI.

However, the relatives of the two injured showed receipt to the police issued by the Jaipur Municipal Corporation on Monday at 1.37am. On the receipt, it is written that the estimated cost of three cows and two calves is Rs 90,000. The JMC also collected Rs 600 as tax from the duo. The receipt was issued in the name of one Altaf, resident of Pahari of Bharatpur, who was one of the injured in the mini-truck.

“Wahid, a resident of Nuh (Haryana) and Altaf, resident of Pahari (Bharatpur) were in the vehicle. They were beaten up by cow vigilantes,” claimed Shokat, a relative of the injured. He also showed the receipt issued by JMC claiming that they were not cow smugglers and had bought the cows from a cattle market in Hatwara, Jaipur.

Despite Ashok Gehlot-led state government enacting a law to prevent mob lynching, such incidents are reported quite frequently.

Title: Thyagaraja tribute back on stage after 28 years
Content:
‘Thyaagaraaja Vaibhavam’, the two-hour drama focuses on bhakti as the highest form of ‘shringara’.

CHENNAI: It was while listening to the rendering of ‘nannu vidachi’ by M D Ramanathan that veteran Bharatanatyam dancer V P Dhananjayan decided to produce a dance drama on the Carnatic composer Thyagaraja (1767 to 1847) in 1992.‘Thyaagaraaja Vaibhavam’, the two-hour drama focuses on bhakti as the highest form of ‘shringara’. It was challenging because Thyagaraja kritis were never considered favourites in Bharatanatyam, as their concentration on bhakti and lack of ‘shringara bhava’ (romantic love) discouraged dancers from exploring their potential as dance music.The two-hour drama was broadcast on television but gradually lost its theatrical value. Dhananjayan has now revived the drama to portray the essence of Thyagaraja’s musical achievement through some of his great compositions."It was a great experience when we first did the play in 1992. A journey through Thyagaraja’s compositions was challenging. But the spirit has doubled as years passed. We used simple attires to get a natural feel for the character in the drama," said Dhananjayan, who donned the role of Thyagaraja in the play, which was staged at Kalakshetra Foundation recently.Thyagaraja was born in Tiruvarur, an ancient town on the banks of the Cauvery. He composed and sang hundreds of songs in praise of Rama, his beloved deity during a span of 80 years."Thyagaraja, along with his contemporaries Shyama Shastri and Muthuswami Dikshitar, have enriched Carnatic music. The music of this great saint composer is dedicated to the attainment of peace and happiness through sacrifice and renunciation. It is bhakti yoga at its highest," said Dhananjayan, who choreographed the dance drama based on on the lyrics of Thyagaraja and Mysore Vasudevacharya.The 81-year-old dancer immersed himself into a musical sojourn before taking up the project again."I explored the life of Thyagaraja through some of his main compositions. I listened to many of them in 1992 and when I thought of reviving the drama, I went through the songs again. I think I learn something new each time I listen to him," he said.‘Thyaagaraaja Vaibhavam’, according to Dhananjayan, attempts to portray the musical achievement of Thyagaraja through his own compositions. "When Thyagaraja’s brother threw away the Rama idols into the Cauvery, the result was more music expressing the bhakt’s anguish. When he miraculously recovered the idols, there was more music this time of a rapturous mood," he said.The use of shadow play in the background to interpret the song being portrayed on stage makes the drama different. "We revived the play because we thought it is a great tribute to Thyagaraja. The play will also create awareness among youngsters about the great composer," said Dhananjayan.

Title: Pune’s traffic issues a big worry, says Fadnavis
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

TOITOI

Pune: Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) state unit chief Chandrakant Patil on Monday said the party could have formed the government in Maharashtra had its alliance partner not ditched them.

He was speaking at a programme to felicitate the mayor Murlidhar Mohol in Kothrud. Mohol was felicitated by a group of citizens in Kothrud for becoming the first mayor from the area.

Leaders from different political parties were present at the event.

“From now on, the elections will not be won through event management. Those who can win the trust of the public will sail through,” Patil said, adding that former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis was able to build such trust.

“Fadnavis would have broken the record of former chief minister Vasantrao Naik (for being the longest serving CM), had there been no back-stabbing,” Patil said. Naik was the longest serving CM of Maharashtra, who had a tenure of 11 years.

Patil, who is the Kothrud MLA, said redevelopment of slums int the city was a major concern. He said the slum rehabilitation authority schemes were not proving to be successful.

Leader of the opposition in the state assembly Devendra Fadnavis said resolving traffic issues would be a challenge in Pune. “The traffic and sewage issues are causing pollution. Vehicular population and the large number of two-wheelers in the city are a big worry. Green transport should be promoted. The aim should be to develop a pollution-free Pune,” he said.

Title: Online monitoring system at 128 exam centres to check copying in UP Boards
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Kanpur: Around 1,07,069 students of the city will appear for UP Boards high school and intermediate examinations commencing from Tuesday.

Ahead of the beginning of the examination on Sunday, DIoS Satish Tiwari inspected Onkareshwar Saraswati Vidya Niketan and online monitoring systems raised in all 128 examination centres of the city.

All the centres have been divided into 16 sectors which would be supervised by sector magistrate. Three centres have been identified as sensitive. Five flying squads have been constituted to raid and check the centres.

Elaborate arrangements have been made by the district administration, district inspector of schools for free and fair exams. Heads of all the examination centres have been instructed to maintain uninerrupted 4G internet and power services at their centre.

As many as 7,800 invigilators would conduct the examinations at 128 centres, he informed.

In a specific directives, the DIoSd has directed the centre superintendents to ensure that a teacher is not deployed as invigilator in the examination of his/her subject.

Meanwhile, Aradhana Shukla chief secretary Madhyamik Education board said that the examinees must carry their admit card, registration card and identity card like Aadhar card with them.

The examinees will not be allowed to carry any electronic device and reading material to the exam centre, she said. However, they can carry transparent geometry box and water bottles and share their problems, if any, with their invigilator, she added.

The UP Board examinatons will commence with Hindi. High school examinees will take the papers in morning while exams for intermediates will be conducted in evening session.

Title: Kickboxing champ turned passion into career
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Right from his school days, Akshay Kumar M knew that academics was not his strength. So, he shifted his concentration to kickboxing and, over the past six years, dedicated his life to learning the sport. Recently, Kumar won the Wako Indian Open International Kickboxing tournament.

Speaking from experience, Kumar says that sports is as important as studies, if not more. He also feels learning a sport can give a person something to fall back on if one doesn’t excel in academics.

“I somehow cleared my class 10 board examinations but was never bright in studies. In fact, I failed in my intermediate, graduation and post-graduation,” said Kumar adding that he is currently trying his best to clear three backlogs and earn an MBA degree.

“I feel studies too is very important. That’s the reason why I want to complete my MBA,” he added.

Kumar said that he is currently earning his livelihood by teaching kickboxing at a wellness centre and working as a personal coach. He said that right from a young age he was very good in sports and learnt soccer, karate, among other sports.

Title: Lucknow: Boy held for CAA stir gets special leave for board exams
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image
