The plan may be implemented from the last week of February itself.”Solid waste management rules (2016) empower the local bodies to decide the user fee. It may be levied by other corporations as well in near future, the official added.The quantum of user fee for residential properties may vary between Rs 50 and Rs 200 per month. “Proposed charges will be around Rs 50 per month for plots having area up to 50 square metres. For the residential properties having an area between 50 and 200 square metres, the charges will be Rs 100 per month. For all residential properties above 200 sqm, a fee of Rs 200 will have to be paid,” said another official.Street vendors may also have to pay an user fee of Rs 100 per month. For bigger commercial establishments like hotels, the user fee will be higher. “Our representatives will issue receipts as per the house category. We are planning to enforce these charges with effect from January 2020 itself,” added the official.“Sanitary supervisors will issue challans to those who do not pay the user charge.”A senior official said that levying of charges was cleared by the court in February 2018 itself, and the process had been delayed.“With no financial help coming from Delhi government, the municipal corporation has no other way, but to increase the internal sources of revenue. Notices about the user fee have already been issued in some areas,” the official added.Responding to TOI query, north corporation commissioner, Varsha Joshi, said that there will be clarity on the issue in a few days.

Title: Meerut: Amangarh reserve to get 2 solar-powered borewells
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Sources said that the step would also minimise man-animal conflict as animals often move towards human settlem... Read More

BIJNOR: Ahead of summer season, forest officials are planning to construct two borewells with solar pumps in Amangarh Tiger Reserve to provide drinking water for animals. The step is being taken to maintain adequate levels in the waterholes.

Sources said that the step would also minimise man -animal conflict in the region as animals often move towards human settlements in search of water during peak summer.

Bijnor divisional forest officer M Semmaran said, “The move is aimed at maintaining water in ponds and holes so that animals can quench their thirst. Besides, these pumps will help in putting out wildfires too.” “There is no provision to lay power lines in forest areas. Hence, solar pumps will help in extracting groundwater. In the first phase, two solar pumps will be installed at a cost of Rs 20 lakh,” he added.

According to officials, forest department had sent a proposal to the higher authorities for installing four solar pumps in ATR. However, only two have been sanctioned this year. While one is close to Jhirna range of Corbett reserve, the other will be at Phakkad crossing of ATR.

Officials said that the pumps are being installed as ground water is found at a level of 300 feet in the region.

Amangarh Tiger Reserve is home to over 22 tigers, 25 leopards and a large number of herbivores. There are 12 waterholes in the reserve that attract wild animals.

Title: Ayodhya outlay to define BJP agenda for Uttar Pradesh 2022 assembly elections
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

LUCKNOW: Budgetary sanctions for schemes run by the UP culture and tourism departments for financial year 2021 will outline ruling BJP’s agenda for the 2022 assembly elections.

Sources said that both the Centre and state governments are banking largely on the Ram Temple to showcase their achievements in 2022. Officials in the two departments have held several brainstorming sessions to give a large share to Ayodhya.

“The central government has already formed a trust for construction of the temple. But a lot has to be done around it. Both culture and tourism departments are pitching in with the best,” said a senior officer. It is for this that the state government has proposed setting up of the Ramjanmabhoomi Teertha development board.

The board — which will pool in funds from various departments, particularly culture and tourism — will be responsible for development of tourist facilities of international standards in the temple town. Sources said that activities worth Rs 250 crore have been charted for implementation for the first two years.

Also, projects related to the towering Ram statue and Navya Ayodhya are most likely to get their due. The list includes building gardens, theme park, five star hotels, digital museum and convention centre. Likewise, the state may contribute towards the ongoing facelift of the Ayodhya railway station being done by the ministry of railways.

Budgetary sanctions for Ayodhya may come from other heads as well. Projects to improve road and air connectivity with Ayodhya are also on the anvil. According to officials, the CM wants the bus terminus in Ayodhya to be augmented to be able to hold 3,000-4000 buses at a time. Likewise, allocation for the medical college in Ayodhya is also expected through the medical education department.

Push to religious tourism has always been the top priority of Yogi government since the budget placed in 2017.

Significant budgetary sanctions were made for development of tourist facilities in Varanasi (Rs 200 crore for cultural centre), Gorakhpur (Rs 25 crore for development of Ramgarh Taal) and Vindhyanchal (Rs 10 crore for infrastructure building), in addition to allocations for Ayodhya (Rs 3 crore for Ramayana Conclave) and Mathura-Braj region. The government also organised the first grand Diwali celebrations in Ayodhya and scaled up the Holi celebrations in Brij.

In 2018, sanctions for Mathura-Vrindavan were made. The government also formed the Braj Teerth Vikas Parishad to promote religious tourism in the region. Besides, projects in Ayodhya and Varanasi were allocated more funds.

In 2019-20s the tourism department provided for Rs 125 crore for infrastructural facilities in Uttar Pradesh Braj Teerth, while Rs 101 crore was proposed for integrated development of major tourist places in Ayodhya. Among other projects, culture and tourism departments provided construction of boundary walls around Ramlila ground in different cities.

Title: Speeding truck mows down Metro project security guard in Pune
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The Bund Garden police have seized the truck

PUNE: A security guard (40) of a private company engaged in the construction of the Pune Metro project died after a truck hit him on the Raja Bahadur Mill road on Monday morning while he was on his way to collect salary.

The Bund Garden police said Siddharth, alias Raju Pandurang Kamble of Mangalwar Peth, was on leave on Monday and had gone to the company’s office to collect his salary.

The police arrested the truck driver, Digambar Talikote (50) of Katraj, for rash and negligent driving. Kamble’s friend, Vinod Shankar Shendge (34) of Mangalwar Peth, lodged a complaint with the police.

Assistant inspector Amol Kale of Bund Garden police said Kamble and Shendge worked as marshals with the company and were deployed at the Metro project site on the Raja Bahadur Mill road.

“Around 11.30am, the two friends walked down to the point where the Raja Bahadur Mill road and the street leading to the Kailas Crematorium grounds meet. The truck speeding towards the Jehangir Hospital Chowk from the RTO Chowk hit Kamble at the spot,” the officer said.

“Kamble sustained serious head injuries and was taken to the Sassoon General Hospital , where doctors declared him dead,” he said.

Kamble was mostly deputed on night duty and would regulate traffic on the Raja Bahadur Mill road. “He also guarded the construction material at the site,” Kale said.

The police said the accident spot was a narrow lane. Several local residents rued that the lane has footpath “in patches” and said the authorities should ensure safety for the people walking down to the colleges, crematorium ground and the hospitals in the vicinity.

Title: Teen caught raping 6-year-old, villagers hand him over to cops

This story is from February 18, 2020

Title: Tiff over seat: Woman stabbed on RTC bus in Telangana
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A tiff over a man occupying a ladies’ seat resulted in the culprit stabbing a woman passenger aboard an RTC bus here on Sunday night. The woman, who suffered an eight-cm cut on her stomach, is out of danger and police launched a manhunt to nab the offender.

Around 11.45pm, an RTC bus of Farooqnagar depot (8C) stopped in front of the Afzalgunj police station with an injured woman passenger, Anuradha, 40, a garments store worker from West Marredpally, police said. “Anuradha suffered an eight centimetre cut on her stomach. We rushed her to Osmania General Hospital for treatment and her condition is out of danger,” Afzalgunj inspector P Gyanender Reddy said.

The victim, in her statement, told police that she got into the bus at AG’s office to go to Chandrayangutta. When the bus reached Exhibition Grounds, more women passengers got in and Anuradha noticed that the man was occupying a seat reserved for women. “An argument broke out between Anuradha and the accused. As he used foul language, Anuradha slapped him. The accused pulled out a sharp-edged weapon and attacked her on the stomach. After the assault, the accused disembarked from the bus at Begum Bazar and fled,” the inspector said. During preliminary probe, police found that the accused boarded the bus at Secunderabad and purchased a ticket till Chandrayangutta. “We have transferred the case to Begum Bazar police,” he added.

Title: Audience enjoy musical journey with ‘Karvaan Suron Kaa’
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: It was a wonderful musical tour as singers regaled the audience with Hindi and Marathi hits at a programme ‘Karvaan Suron Kaa’ organized by Swarved and Swar Ragini at Sceintific Society Hall, Laxmi Nagar, on Sunday.

The list of 22 songs comprised evergreen singles and duets. The event kick-started with the praising Lord Ganesha with the song ‘Hey Gajvandana’.

Ankita Takle added element to the atmosphere with the famous Marathi song ‘Mi raat takali’ followed by Aditya Savarkar’s performance ‘Ketaki gulaab juhi’ that made the audience remember the film ‘Basant Bahar’.

Shruti Baivar’s soulful rendition of the song ‘Chupke se chupke se’ caught the attention of all. She also entertained with other songs including ‘Ghar more pardesiya’, ‘Allah yeh adaa’ and ‘Raati ardhya raati’.

A duet by Savarkar and Baivar on the peppy song ‘Ek mai aur ek tu’ was appreciated by one and all.

Yash Kher gave justice to Swapnil Bandodkar’s song ‘Gaalavar khali’. Takle gave audience a series of wonderful solos, of which ‘Chitthiye’ received repeated applauses.

Takle and Savarkar’s ‘Le kar hum deewana dil’ from the movie ‘Yaadon ki baarat’ literally made the audience jog down the memory lane.

Other songs that were presented by the artistes include ‘Chal chhaiyya chhaiyya’, ‘Naa toh karvaan ki talash hain’, ‘Mere jeevan saathi’, ‘Aa dekhe zara’, ‘Hawa hawai’, ‘Om shanti om’, ‘Akhiya bhul gayi hai sona’ and some more.

The LED display on the stage being played in sync with the performances gave audience a complete musical experience.

Anchor Kishor Galande didn’t miss out on entertaining audience with some anecdotes.

The singers were accompanied by the instrumentalists Ravi Satfale, Gaurav Tanksale, Charudatta Dev, Pankaj Yadav, Saurabh Killedar, Akshay Harley and Vikram Joshi.

(Reporting by Janhavi Dave)

Title: Secret GOs: HC wants answers by Feb 28
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Wondering why the state is shying away from filing its counter in a public interest litigation (PIL) which questioned the attitude of the government in keeping almost half of its government orders (GOs) away from public gaze and the huge number of secret GOs that are not accessible to the citizens, the Telangana high court on Monday directed the Telangana government to file its counter by February 28.

A bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy gave this direction while hearing the PIL filed by BJP activist Perala Sekhar Rao, questioning the state’s action in not keeping all GOs in public domain.

“The state is allowed to keep certain sensitive orders away from the public domain, but all GOs cannot be brought under this category,” the petitioner said. Of the nearly a lakh GOs the state had issued between June, 2014, and August, 2019, as many as 42,000 GOs were marked ‘secret’ and made inaccessible to the public, he said. All important GOs should be uploaded on the state website and an officer has to be appointed to see that these GOs were properly uploaded and the state website properly maintained, he said. The bench too questioned the state counsel as to why the government did not file its counter though a direction was given to do so in September 2019 itself.

Title: Container derails at Vadodara rly station
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The derailment occurred on the up line towards Mumbai on Monday

Vadodara: Container of a goods train derailed near platform one of Vadodara railway station on Monday noon.

Two wheels of a front trolley of the goods container derailed just as the train was passing from near platform one.

The goods train had 45 loaded containers of which the 11th from the engine got derailed.

The train had started its journey from Dadri near Allahabad and was on its way to Jawaharlal Nehru Port in Mumbai.

The derailment occurred on the up line towards Mumbai. However, it did not disrupt train traffic movement on the line as there were no trains scheduled to arrive at the time of derailment.

“An accident relief medical equipment reached the spot and it was re-railed before 1 pm. No trains got delayed due to the derailment,” said Khemraj Meena, public relations officer of Vadodara railway division.

Title: Jaipur: BJP MLA’s feud with SDM reaches speaker
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Chomu’s BJP MLA Ramlal Sharma

JAIPUR: A feud on a whatsapp group between Chomu’s BJP MLA Ramlal Sharma and SDM Himmat Singh prompted the MLA to reach the collectorate on Monday and take up the matter with district collector Joga Ram. The MLA also raised the issue with Assembly speaker C P Joshi, who assured him of proper action and referring the matter to the privileges committee.

"I had raised questions in the assembly regarding the number of names added and deleted under the food security act. But, I didn't get a satisfactory reply from the government. I had complained regarding this to the speaker and appropriate action was taken," Sharma told TOI.

“Following this, the SDM made the issue public on a WhatsApp group. That's why I complained to the collector about the SDM's misconduct on social media. I also met the speaker today and informed him about it. I also told him it is my right to raise questions about the schemes. The speaker took the matter seriously and told me to submit the printouts of the SDM's remarks on WhatsApp group along with my viewpoint on a letterhead. He said he will refer it to the privileges committee," Sharma added. "The collector said he will speak with the SDM on the issue," he further said.

Joga Ram said, "He (the MLA) has not submitted any written application. I will look into the matter. It (the complaint) was about the functioning of the SDM."

Meanwhile, Himmat Singh said, "He (MLA) has a problem with the process of adding names of eligible persons under the food security act. I add the names in a very transparent and unbiased manner. It was Sharmaji who first mentioned on the WhatsApp group that action will be taken against the SDM by the speaker. So, I replied that names of eligible persons will only be added. But, he wanted the names recommended by him (the MLA) to be added. He alleged I was adding names as per the recommendations of Congress councillors. However, I don't have any personal issue with him."

Title: Shaheen Bagh protests: Supreme Court appoints mediators to get Shaheen protesters off road
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: Disapproving the continuing blockade at Shaheen Bagh and expressing the hope that good sense would prevail over anti-CAA agitators leading them to vacate the road and shift their protest to an alternative site, the Supreme Court on Monday asked senior advocates Sanjay Hegde, Sadhana Ramachandran and former chief information commissioner Wajahat Habibullah to hold consultations with the agitators.

Though a bench of Justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul and KM Joseph held organising protests is good for democracy and people have a fundamental right to dissent against the Citizenship Amendment Act even when the matter is pending in court, they disapproved the practice of blocking roads and public places during stir. “We are not saying that people have no right to protest during the pendency of the case. It is people’s fundamental right to assemble and protest. But the question is where to protest. Tomorrow there may be another law passed and what will happen if people start blocking roads in protest. What will happen if everybody starts blocking the roads. Our concern is what would it lead to if people start blocking the roads. It will create chaos,” the bench said.

It said there are people who are supporting the law and they can also resort to blocking roads and that would further create problem.

“What is troubling us is the blocking of public roads,” it said, emphasising that it was best to find out amicable solution to the problem by convincing protesters to shift their site of protest and clear the road for traffic.

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta, appearing for Delhi Police, said that common people are facing problem due to Shaheen Bagh protests and told the bench that the police tried its best to persuade the protesters but they refused. He said that protesters are using women and children as shield due to which it has not been able to take any action against the protesters who are keeping the city to “hostage” under the garb of protest.

But the bench also pulled up the government for not taking steps to resolve the problem in the last 60 days after Mehta contended that an impression should not go that authorities are kneeling down before the protesters. The court asked the Centre to explore all possibility and grant the protesters an alternate place to hold protests. “You can give a few options to protesters. Let you not close your mind, and try all possibilities,” the bench told the Centre.

The court said it is very important that people are allowed to protest but every right comes with a responsibility and there are lines and boundaries within which people should hold protest in democracy.

Hoping that protesters at Shaheen Bagh will realise and vacate the road, the bench said, “We expressed our opinion what we want to do. We are hopeful that reason will prevail on them. It is not a pleasant task but we have taken up the task to resolve it”.

The apex court was hearing an appeal filed by advocate Amit Sahni and BJP leader Nand Kishore Garg seeking its directions to the Delhi Police to remove the protesters from Shaheen Bagh to ensure smooth traffic flow on the Kalindi Kunj-Shaheen Bagh stretch, which has been blocked by anti-CAA protesters since December 15.

Wajahat Habibullah and Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad also moved the SC seeking impleadment in the case and alleged that the Delhi administration had deliberately blocked other roads connecting the capital to Noida and Faridabad to create public inconvenience. They contended that there were other routes which could be used for traffic movement after the main road was blocked due to the protests but the administration had deliberately blocked those roads on the pretext of the ongoing demonstration.

Title: Shrachi group division bags BHEL order worth Rs 365 cr
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: BTL EPC Ltd, a division of Shrachi Group, on Monday bagged an order worth Rs 365 crore from BHEL for setting up 5 X 800 MW Yadradri Thermal Power Station being set up by the Telangana State Power Generation Corporation Limited for coal, limestone and gypsum handling plant at Nalgonda district in the state.

The project consists of conveyor system expanding a total length of 21.77 km. In 2018, the company had bagged an order worth Rs 228 crore for coal handling plant project from BHEL for BIFPCL (Bangladesh India Friendship Power Project Corporation Ltd, Maitree) which is at an advanced stage of execution with orders worth Rs 100 crore already completed.

Title: Infrastructure not ready, Miramar beach misses Blue Flag certification
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Miramar beach

PANAJI: Miramar beach is likely to lose out on the Blue Flag certification , at least for now, with the Union environment ministry not inviting Goa for the meeting to review Beach Environment Aesthetic Management Systems (BEAMS).

A senior official said the Centre had only invited those states where infrastructure has been completed or is in progress. As the certification team conducts an inspection visit once a year, Goa and Maharashtra will not be among the states that will have Blue Flag certified beaches, the official said.

Those who will participate in the meeting include Daman and Diu, Gujarat, Karnataka, Kerala, Puducherry, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha and Andaman and Nicobar.

In October last year, the high court of Bombay at Goa has stayed operations of the July 12, 2019, notification for Blue Flag certification of Miramar beach after an activist filed a public interest litigation (PIL) before it.

The PIL had stated that the Union environment ministry issued the notification without a draft notification, public hearing or inviting objections from the public.

The project is already being opposed by some local groups and fishermen stating that work on raising infrastructure at Miramar for the Blue Flag certification should not begin until the draft Coastal Zone Management Plan for Goa is finalised.

The Union environment ministry had prepared an estimate of about Rs 8 crore for setting up bamboo and wood toilets, a sewage treatment plant, showers, a lifeguard cabin, outdoor gym, water quality monitoring, cleaning of beach stretch, disability access and maintenance for two years. Thereafter, the infrastructure was to be transferred to Goa Tourism Development Corporation , a senior official said.

The Blue Flag certification from the Foundation for Education, Denmark, is a voluntary certification where countries have to meet 33 criteria for chosen beaches. It is one of the most stringent certification related to sustainable ecotourism development of beaches encompassing high quality standards of water quality, safety of beach goers, public amenities, sound waste management plans, focus on renewable energy and water conservation, environment education, information on biodiversity and beach ecology.

The government of India has launched an ambitious program to get 100 beaches certified by 2024 with central funds.

The officer said that in addition to Miramar, five other beaches were selected for the certification — Agonda, Palolem, Benaulim, Baina and Morjim. However, there has been no response from the state administration to constitute beach management committees.

Title: Dalit girl’s rape & murder in Dehradun: NCSC asks Doon DM, SSP to be present during case hearing

Title: Rural cops bust gang of vehicle thieves, six held
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: The local crime branch of Aurangabad rural police busted an interstate gang of vehicle thieves and arrested six people, including a sub-contractor working with Samruddhi Mahamarg, the super expressway connecting Mumbai – Nagpur.

Police have seized three vehicles, including a heavy vehicle. Teams have been sent to recover other vehicles that were stolen and sold off in different parts of the country.

The arrested suspects have been identified as Shivaji Lahire (32) of Vaijapur tehsil of Aurangabad, his brother in-law Mahesh alias Kahar Birute (35) of Amardham in Nashik. The police have also arrested Surat residents Abdul Kalam Chaudhary (40), Diwankar alias Chotu Chavan (22), Shubhneskumar Bhatiya (26) and Mohammed Istikhan (30).

Addressing a news conference, Aurangabad rural superintendent of police Mokshada Patil said, “The suspects have offences registered against them in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh. Preliminary probe has revealed that this gang may have committed vehicle thefts from Ahmednagar, Pune, Nashik and several other parts of the state.

“The arrested suspects have confessed to their involvement in vehicle thefts and teams are cross-verifying their confessions. Out of the three seized vehicles, one car with registration in Gujarat and a heavy vehicle has Punjab passing have been recovered,” said Patil.

Inspector Bhagwat Phunde said that Abdul Kalam has several cases of vehicle theft registered against him in different states. He is a friend of Birute. They took the help of Lahire to identify heavy vehicles that were being used for carrying of sand and construction material.

On identification of the target vehicle, Chavan and Bhatiya would turn up and steal the vehicle. To avoid getting caught in the CCTV cameras installed at the toll plazas on the highway, the duo would take Lahire’s help and drive through internal roads of rural Nashik.

At Nashik, Istikhan would disable the GPS installed, if any, on the vehicles, before handing over the stolen vehicles to Abdul Kalam.

LCB’s assistant inspector Bhagatsingh Dulat said each member of the gang had a specific role and precaution was taken that others do not know the role of the others in the gang.

“The suspects used a toolkit and used it to change the chassis as well as engine number of the stolen vehicle. These numbers are matched with the documents of an existing original vehicle, making it difficult even for the government agencies to catch the theft,” said Dulat.

Title: Delhi: Senior embassy official booked for molestation

Title: Muslim college girls in Khurja harassed for not wearing ‘burqa’
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The officials warned the people of the area that those harassing the college girls will be booked and arrested... Read More

MEERUT: After being harassed and asked to wear ‘ burqa ’ to save themselves from regular teasing, scores of college girls from the minority community on Monday approached sub divisional magistrate (SDM) in Bulandshahr’s Khurja and sought action. Acting swiftly on the complaint, SDM Isha Priya, accompanied by station house officer (SHO) of the area, reached the locality where the girls were being harassed, and held a meeting with the residents.

The officials warned the people of the area that those harassing the college girls will be booked and arrested.

SDM Priya said, “Some miscreants in Sarai Murtaza colony were harassing the girls and asking them to wear burqa. The girls told us that when their families had no problem in sending them college, then how can these men raise questions?”

The SDM held a meeting with the locals and encouraged them to continue sending their daughters to college. “We could have filed a case and arrested the accused. But, as of now, we are just issuing warning,” she said.

The locals and religious heads of the community assured the SDM and the police that the incident of harassment will not be repeated.

Title: Alwar: Man irritated over barking of dog kills his owner
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

ALWAR: Frequent quarrels over barking of a dog led to the murder of its owner in Alwar on Sunday.

Akash Jat (31), posted as a tax assistant at income tax department, has been arrested for allegedly stabbing a 40-year-old engineer Santosh Sharma repeatedly. Jat is a resident of Rohtak of Haryana.

Shocked over the incident, passersby overpowered Jat and handed him over to Sadar police station. Sharma’s relatives have reached Alwar from UP. Police have handed over the body to his relatives after conducting autopsy.

Sharma was from Kasopur in UP’s Gorakhpur district. Residents of the colony told police that it was not for the first time they had fought over barking of the dog owned by Sharma. They were living in the same Shalimar Residential Colony.

While Santosh was walking with his dog around 8.30pm, Akash’s mother had an argument with Santosh over barking of the dog. Akash came out of his house and started fighting with Sharma. He went back to his house and brought a knife and stabbed Sharma. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him brought dead. He suffered injuries on his check and stomach.

Title: Hyderabad: Man gets 20-year rigorous imprisonment in rape case
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

Title: Meerut: Locals block Bulandshahr road over murder of ex-pradhan
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative Image

MEERUT: Residents of Kailavan village in Bulandshahar district kept the body of a former village head, Sanjay Sharma (45), on the state highway on Monday to press for immediate arrest of the culprits. Sharma, also a local Samajwadi Party leader, was shot at multiple times by rivals in the village on Sunday.

Seven people, including former block pramukh, Mukesh Sharma who is the main accused, have been named in the FIR for murder. But police are yet to make any arrests.

The sit-in with protesters raising slogans continued for three to four hours, forcing senior police officers to rush to the spot. The protest was called off only after the senior officers persuaded the villagers to lift the blockade and assured the agitating family of strict action in the case.

The deceased’s family has expressed anger over the delay in arresting the accused and is also concerned about its security.

Trying to allay their fears, Harendra Kumar , Bulandshahr superintendent of police (rural areas) said, “We have assured them of that the accused will be arrested at the earliest and the family will be provided security. Raids are being conducted to nab the accused.”

According to sources, the murder is a fallout of an ongoing political rivalry in the village. According to police, Sanjay Sharma and an acquaintance were returning from the field on a motorcycle on Sunday evening when they were confronted by the rival group at a wedding function. An argument took place between then and took an ugly turn when the assailants opened fire at him and his aide. Sanjay Sharma later succumbed to bullet injuries at a local hospital.

Title: Meerut: Police book husband, in-laws for murder woman, 2 kids
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative Image

HARVEER: Police have claimed to have made a breakthrough in a case relating to the death of a woman and her two children in Amroha district and registered an FIR against four people, including her husband and in-laws for murder. No one has been arrested so far. A probe is on.

According to officials, on February 13, a 26-year-old woman, Saaema, was found hanging while her two children, a two-and-a-half year-old daughter and a 17 month-old son, were found dead under mysterious circumstances in their house at Sentali village under Didoli police station in Amroha.

Initially, the deceased’s husband, Mohammad Aasif, had claimed that his wife had committed suicide after killing her two children. But the post-mortem report of the woman said she was strangled.

Based on a written complaint by Saaema’s brother, an FIR under relevant sections has been registered against Aasif, his brother, Aakib, sister, Salma, and sister’s husband, Rizwan.

Talking with TOI, Amroha superintendent of police Vipin Tada said, “Police are probing the matter thoroughly. A police team on Saturday had gone to Aasif’s house but at that time, a family member had taken ill and police had to come back. The post-mortem report of the woman had revealed that she did not commit suicide but she may have been strangled to death. Her brother has alleged that Aasif and his family members tortured her for dowry and they murdered her and her two children.”

Tada claimed, “Police is on the right track and will crack the case soon.”

Title: Not so smart! Signals flicker on & off
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The smart city development corporation has again missed the deadline to make two traffic signals on the smart road fully operational.

The Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation Ltd (NMSCDCL) was to make the two signals — at Meher and CBS junctions — functional by February 15. However, the trials are still on and the signals are yet to be connected with the command and control room in the Panchavati divisional office, officials said.

“Currently, we are doing data analysis and testing proof of concepts of the traffic signals. This is a new concept and we are studying it. We will make both the traffic signals on smart city road operational with monitoring from the command and control centre once our trials are over,” said Prakash Thavil, the CEO of NMSCDCL.

The traffic signals will have advanced CCTV cameras to identify traffic violations and capture the registration numbers of vehicles. It will identify red signal violations too.

Around 800 cameras are to be installed under the smart city mission. Of which, some CCTV cameras with advanced security features are to be installed on all 50 traffic signals across the city. The pilot project of traffic signals with CCTV cameras is being implemented on smart road stretch of 1.1 km from Ashok Stambh and Trimbak Naka.

NMSCDCL had allowed vehicles to ply on the smart road from January 26 even though some works were yet to be completed such as installing high masts, e-toilets and other facilities along the stretch.

The project of CCTV cameras, Wi-Fi and other ICT (Information Communication Technology) is being implemented by the Maharashtra Information Technology Corporation (MahaIT) at a total cost of Rs 169 crore. Of which, the contribution of the NMSCDCL is Rs 45.43 crore. 800 CCTV cameras are to be installed by the MahaIT at major locations across the city. A command and control room is also being set up.

Title: NMC sacks 2nd staffer within 3 days
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation ( NMC ) on Monday dismissed filaria inspector Sanjay Chamke. It is the second termination within three days.

Municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe approved dismissal of Chamke. An NMC official told TOI, “Chamke was absent for 946 days between October 2009 and April 2018 without obtaining permission. Chamke used to also not comply with directives of his seniors. A departmental inquiry also found him guilty,” the official said.

On February 14, the civic body had dismissed property tax collector Anand Fulzele in revenue scam.

It is learnt the NMC has completed departmental inquiries against many employees. After Mundhe assumed charge, action against guilty has been expedited.

Title: LRD stir continues
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Gandhinagar: Agitating women candidates for the Lok Rakshak Dal from the general category called off their protest on Monday, one day after the state government announced that all candidates who scored more than 62.5% in the examination would be selected. Women candidates from reserved categories, who have been protesting for more than 70 days, continued their protest in Gandhinagar.

Dinesh Bhambhaniya of non-reserved caste coordination committee said, “After a meeting with LRD candidates and leaders of the non-reserved category, we have decided to end the protest after the government’s assurance. We believe the government will act according to its announcement. If it does not, we will resume the protest.”

Hasmukh Saxsena, convener, Bandharaniya Adhikar Andolan Samiti said, “We have not changed our demand. The protest by women of reserved categories will end only after the government withdraws the August 2018 GR.”

Title: Newborn missing from Meerut medical college rescued
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

The accused is still on the run

MEERUT: Nearly two weeks after a newborn baby went missing from Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial (LLRM) Medical College, Meerut police have rescued the baby from Lisari Gate area on Monday even as the woman who kidnapped the baby is still on the run.

Inquiry revealed that the accused Suraiya hatched a plan to kidnap the baby as she couldn’t conceive even in her third marriage. Police later rescued the baby and handed him over to the family.

Meerut SP (city) Akhilesh Narayan Singh said, “The accused married Aasif a few years ago. The couple used to fight often as she was unable to conceive a child. While Aasif was away for work, she started roaming with a fake pregnancy bump to misguide the locals and her husband. Meanwhile, she was also looking for a newborn in LLRM Medical College .”

According to police, the plan of stealing the baby came up in the mind of the accused a few days ago when she had gone to stay at her sister’s house in Ajrara village of Meerut district . Police said that there she saw a neighbour, Sumaiya, who was eight months pregnant at the time. “She waited for the delivery of Sumaiya and then stole the baby. While we have rescued the baby safely, the accused is still on the run. Police teams have been formed to arrest her at the earliest,” said Singh.

The newborn boy was stolen allegedly by a woman in her forties from LLRM Medical College on February 3. His family mistook the woman to be hospital staff when she started helping them. Later, she stole the baby by sending away his father to dispose a diaper. As soon as the man went near the dustbin, the woman fled with the baby. He tried to chase her but she melted into the crowd.

Title: With tourists cancelling Goa plans, state withdraws Section 144
Content:
Goa tourist

PANAJI: Nearly a week after the tourism industry took a severe beating, and following criticism from various sections of the society, the state government on Monday withdrew its notification imposing Section 144 of the CrPC for a 60-day period.The notification dated February 10, 2020, had created panic and fear among locals as well as tourists , who even cancelled their travel plans to Goa.TOI was the first to report the implications the notification had on the tourism industry, which had led to cancellation of holiday bookings, including that for the Carnival week.Slamming the government, tourism stakeholders had said that the notification inflicted a severe blow to the already limping industry and that the government needed to reassure tourists that holidaying in Goa was safe as usual.“The order issued under Section 144 of CrPC stands withdrawn with immediate effect,” North Goa district magistrate Gopal Parsekar said. Additional collector, South Goa, Surendra Naik also issued a similar order.Invoking Section 144 of CrPC, the district authorities had highlighted that Goa was facing a possible terror threat and that restrictions had to be imposed for proper tenant verification and identification in cyber cafes.Following an outcry from tourism stakeholders, chief minister Pramod Sawant on Saturday tried to play down the notification by stating that there was no terror alert for the state and that it had been merely issued as a routine affair. He also said that tourists should not worry about visiting the state, including for the weeklong Carnival festivities, which begin on February 22.“We are thinking of withdrawing the notification. There is unnecessary panic due to media highlighting the notification. There is no terror alert for the state and people should not panic. I welcome tourists to visit Goa,” Sawant had said.District magistrate North Goa R Menaka, who is currently on leave, also came out with a detailed clarification to her February 10 notification on Saturday. She said that though Section 144 has been imposed, it would not prevent assembly of four or more persons.The order is a precautionary measure only to step up alertness, essentially to impose tenant verification on all the owners of residential accommodations, private guesthouses, paying guest accommodations, etc, so that there is proper verification of antecedents before premises are let out on lease, rent or hire basis, the North Goa collector had said.Menaka also tried to underplay the effect on tourism due to her order.“The order doesn’t impact tourists, Carnival, Shigmo or other celebrations. The public should not panic as these orders have been routinely issued as part of general preparedness in the past too for the entire state by both the district magistrates,” Menaka had said.

Title: Application alleges copyright agent extorting traders
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Ahmedabad: Hemant Patel of Dharma Society in Vastrapur has submitted an application of complaint to the police against a man who allegedly identifies himself as a copyright agent and extorts money from shopkeepers scaring them of trademark violations in branded products stored by them.

Police sources said the complainant has alleged that the accused shows the card of a copyright protection company and threatens traders that he will arrange police raids if they don’t pay him protection money. The complaint has claimed that the person keeps an authority letter, which seems to be fake, with him. According to the application of complaint no one knows who has signed the letter and in which designation he works for the company. The complainant has alleged that it also not written in the letter whether he has the right to raid or not. Cops are probing the application.

Title: Trio assaulted for not attending birthday party
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Aurangabad: The MIDC Waluj police have booked nine people on the charges of rioting and unlawful assembly after they brutally assaulted three men for not honouring the birthday party invitation that was extended to them.

The police have already arrested two of the nine suspects and were produced before the court on Monday, following which they have been remanded to two days police custody. The two suspects have been identified as Jafar Shaikh and Yusuf Shaikh.

As per the complaint lodged by 31-year old Shaikh Nazim, who runs a paan stall in Sajapur area of Waluj, the suspects reached out to him on Saturday night and asked him the reason for not attending his nephew’s birthday party. Not convinced with the reply, the suspect got into a heated argument with Nazim. The altercation soon took a violent turn, with members of the suspect’s family allegedly carrying sticks joining him.

The incident left Nazim with head injuries including stitches on his head, the two others who rushed to his rescue escaped with minor injuries.

Police sub-inspector Prashant Gambhirrao said that the two of the accused have been arrested, while the others have reportedly gone underground. “Though the complaint specifically mentions that the man was assaulted for not honouring the birthday invitation given by the suspect, but we are not completely convinced with the reason,” said Gambhirrao.

He informed that statements of eyewitnesses have been recorded and they are further checking the background and relations of the victims and the suspects. The suspects have been slapped with charges of voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons, unlawful assembly, rioting, voluntarily causing hurt, an intentional insult for causing a breach of peace and for criminal intimidation.

Title: DMC to install over Rs 1 lakh streetlights in Dehradun
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

DEHRADUN: Dehradun Municipal Corporation ( DMC ) is going to install more than 1 lakh LED streetlights across all 100 wards of the city by the end of this year, officials claimed on Monday. The 68 old wards will get 43,000 new LED streetlights while the 32 new wards will be lit up with 65,000 LED streetlights.

The officials added that DMC has almost achieved its target of installing 43,000 LED streetlights in the old wards but works are yet to start in the 32 new wards. At present, the streetlights in the new wards have sodium bulb which are to be replaced with the LED ones. Also in most of the new wards, there is a need to erect poles as well. According DMC estimates, the LED streetlights are likely to increase the electricity bill by around 40% but they will have a better lifespan as compared to the sodium ones.

Meanwhile, DMC officials also conducted a raid in the Niranjanpur market on Monday for polythene bags. As many as 200 polythene bags were confiscated. DMC officials claimed they have issued a total fine of Rs 1 lakh (Rs 500 per polythene) during the raids. The fines were issued for violating Uttarakhand’s anti-spitting and anti-littering legislation enacted in 2016.

Title: Manjinder Singh Sirsa demands citizenship for Sikhs from Pak
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Manjinder Singh Sirsa

NEW DELHI: Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) president Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Monday demanded immediate citizenship for around 160 Pakistani Hindu Sikh refugee families who have been living in unhygienic conditions in jhuggis and semi-permanent structures on the Yamuna floodplain near Majnu Ka Tila in north Delhi.

Addressing a press conference, Sirsa said around 60 of these families had reached Delhi from Pakistan between February 2 and 15, while 10 families had come just a day ago.

“Around 160 refugee families living in Delhi should be granted Indian citizenship on priority. A majority of the migrant refugees are professionally qualified and willing to contribute to the growth and economy of the country. Many of them are anxious to start working in their respective professions to resume their daily life activities,” Sirsa said, adding that he had requested Union home minister Amit Shah to expedite the citizenship request that was pending with the Centre.

Sirsa added that Shah had a positive reaction to his demands. “He has already instructed the Union home secretary to find out viable legal alternatives to ensure dignified living conditions for these families,” Sirsa said.

Title: Rs 83,000 fine levied on 87 housing societies for defunct rain pits
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Nashik: The civic administration has slapped notices on 87 housing societies and apartments and recovered fine to the tune of Rs 83 ,000 from them since January this year as the rainwater havesting systems installed on their premises were found to be defunct.

As per norms, it is mandatory for residential buildings, societies and apartments constructed on at least 500 sqm of land to have rainwater harvesting systems. While some residential societies and apartments have not put in place the infrastructure, there are others that have installed the rainwater harvesting systems, but they are lying defunct.

The public works department of the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has started a survey based on the directions issued by municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game.

“We have started conducting a survey of housing societies and apartments to ensure they have installed rainwater harvesting systems. Only installing the system is not enough, it should be functional as well,” said officials.

“So far, we have surveyed 583 residential buildings in the city since January 1. During the survey, we found rainwater harvesting system operational in 335 residential buildings, while the facility was lying defunct in 248 buildings,” said civic officials.

“Of the 248 residential buildings where the rainwater harvesting system is lying defunct, we have issued notices and slapped fines of around Rs 1,000 each on 87 buildings. Notices will soon be slapped on 161 residential buildings for not operating their rainwater harvesting system,” said sources in the NMC.

Apart from this, NMC has also started making provisions for rainwater harvesting at its own buildings and properties. The civic administration has over 1,000 properties of which it has possession over 145, while the remaining ones have been leased out to various social outfits. The NMC has decided to install rainwater harvesting system in all its properties.

The civic administration has zeroed in on 110 plots, including its own buildings and properties, where they will install the rainwater harvesting system in the next couple of months.

Title: MSU inks MoU with UK, Kayrgyzstan based varsities
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

MSU vice-chancellor professor Parimal Vyas signs the MoUs

Vadodara: M S University has signed two MoUs with a UK-based and another Kayrgyzstan based varsity.

MSU vice-chancellor professor Parimal Vyas signed the MoUs between London-based Brunel University and Kyrgyz State University of Construction, Transport and Architecture, Bishkek Krygyz Republic, Kayrgyzstan.

The MoUs were facilitated of MSU’s Office of International Affairs (OIA) led by director professor Dhanesh Patel and deputy director professor Vanisha Nambiar.

Professor R C Patel, dean of Faculty of Education, Mayank Vyas, deputy registrar (legal cell) and Dr Rajesh Kelkar, nodal officer of OIA and Dr Ranjit Devkar, coordinator of OIA were also present.

Brunel University, London was represented by its provost professor Rebecca Lingwood and professor Paresh Date. The two universities have planned to collaborate in all areas common to them.

The Kayrgyzstan-based university was represented by Dr Markhabat Karagulova and DInara Omorkulova and the MoU was signed by both teams in the area of culture, science and education.

OIA also felicitated Dr Elizabeth Nicole Kadetsky from Penn State University. Dr Elizabeth, a US-based creative writer and full bright scholar is visiting the campus for a literary discourse in Faculty of Journalism and Communication.

Title: HSC exam: 25 squads to keep an eye in Nashik divn
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: A total of 25 flying squads have been formed to keep a check on the exam centres for the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC, Class XII) examination starting from Tuesday.

The officials of the Nashik division of the Maharashtra State Board for Secondary & Higher Secondary told TOI, “To ensure copy-free examination, the board has formed 25 flying squads. There will be six flying squads in each of the four districts and one special squad of women. The heads of these squads are the education officers of primary, secondary and adult education, assistant deputy director, deputy education officer and education officer of District Institute of Education and Training (DIET).”

These squads, accompanied by a female officer, will be armed with cameras. The squads have been asked to avoid any disturbance to the examinees.

The authorities have also zeroed in on the exam centres where unfair means could be resorted by some examinees.

“The students are advised to reach their respective centres half-an-hour before the commencement of examination as late entries will not be entertained. There should not be any photocopy shop within 100m of the centres,” the officials said. The board said that if a student cannot appear for the oral or practical examination, s/he can appear for ‘out of turn’ examination which will be conducted on March 19 and 20.

Over 1.66 lakh students in four districts of North Maharashtra will appear for the HSC.

After releasing a contact list of counsellors, the state board has also given helpline numbers — 0253-2592141, 0253-2592143 — for students to contact the board in case of any difficulty.

Title: Youth arrested for attacking parents over marriage issue
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: A 26-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly assaulting his parents , one of whom is a senior homeopath, with a kitchen knife over the delay in his marriage in Nanded, about 260km from here, on Sunday.

The suspect, Vallabh Lathkar, was on Monday produced in a local court, which granted him conditional bail, said police.

Investigation officer and police naik KN Sangle citing told TOI that the youth was upset over the delay in his marriage and attacked his father, Sanjay Lathkar, and mother in a fit of rage.

“The youth blamed his parents for delaying his marriage and got into an altercation with his mother on Sunday evening. Around the same time, his father reached home and tried to intervene. The suspect, however, brought a knife from the kitchen and attacked his parents,” he added.

Sangle said that the couple raised an alarm, following which neighbours rushed into their house and rescued them. The youth, however, fled from the scene.

“The couple, who received injuries on the ears and chests, were taken to a nearby hospital, where they were treated and discharged the same day. The statement of Lathkar was taken by police as the hospital recorded a medico legal case. Accordingly, an offence was registered against and the youth arrested.”

Vallabh was booked under under IPC sections 324 (voluntarily causing hurt using dangerous weapon), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of trust) and 506 (criminal intimidation), said police.

Title: One more nabbed for Navlakhi loot
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Vadodara: The special operations group (SOG) arrested a man involved in a loot that happened in Navlakhi compound in 2018. Dilip Solanki was arrested by the cops from Amreli on the basis of tip-off. Dilip is brother of Jasho Solanki, one of the two accused in the gang rape of a minor girl in Navlakhi ground last year.

Dilip, a labourer, had gone to Navlakhi in May 2018 with two other accused Kisan Mathasurya and Sanjay Jakhaniya. The trio had introduced themselves as security guards and threatened a couple hanging out. They looted two mobiles, a gold chain and two silver rings from the couple. Kisan and Sanjay were arrested earlier while Dilip was on the run.

The boy had filed a police complaint in Raopura police station but the case remained unsolved till Kisan was arrested in the gang rape case. He told the cops that his relative had looted the couple last year.

Title: STPI exports to grow 10% this year: DG Rai
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Hyderabad: The Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) expects exports from STPI units, which stood at Rs 4.24 lakh crore in 2018-19, to grow by at least 10% in the current fiscal, STPI Director-General Omkar Rai said on Monday.

“It was Rs 4,24,000 crore last fiscal, STPI export alone, in year 2018-19,” he told newspersons on the sidelines of an event here.

“It will grow in two digits, 10% per cent, over and above. There are indications. Because, our figures are compiled in the month of coming September. I am talking about STPI. Overall export has been estimated and forecast by NASSCOM, just three-four days before...it is $147 billion...and it is an absolutely true figure,” he said.

Rai, who was in town for the launch of the IMAGE centre of excellence set up by STPI and backed by MeitY and the Telangana government in the city, he said the government is now focussed on making India a software product nation.

He said the government has decided to set up 28 CoEs in emerging technologies across the country, of which seven have been launched and 21 are in advanced stages of planning. He said Rs 600 crore has been committed by various stakeholders for the purpose.

He said under the Next Generation Incubation Scheme (NGIS), centres are also being planned in smaller cities like Vijayawada, Mohali, Bhopal, Patna, among others.

Title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for Rajya Sabha: Clamour in Madhya Pradesh Congress
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

BHOPAL: There is rising clamour in Madhya Pradesh Congress for nominating AICC general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to Rajya Sabha from the state.

Three RS seats are falling vacant in MP in April, and two of these would be represented by Congress. One seat will go to BJP. The incumbents are senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh and BJP veterans Prabhat Jha and Satyanarayan Jatiya. Their tenure ends on April 9.

Minister Sajjan Singh Verma, an SC leader known to be close to chief minister Kamal Nath, was the first to suggest that Priyanka be nominated. “Madhya Pradesh is a state with predominant SC and ST population. Former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi had a soft corner for under-privileged communities. Forty years ago, Indira Gandhi brought Kamal Nath to Madhya Pradesh and he was elected MP. Today, the political scenario is such that time has come for Priyanka Gandhi to be sent from the state for a new political start,” he argued.

This triggered a chorus of support. Former Union minister Arun Yadav tweeted, “Time has come that honourable Rahul Gandhiji is again given charge of the party. It will be favourable if Priyanka Gandhiji is given the opportunity to represent Madhya Pradesh in Rajya Sabha so that grassroots struggle against fascist ideology can be intensified.”

Urban administration minister Jaivardhan Singh — Digvijaya’s son — also welcomed the idea. “It would be a matter of delight if Priyanka Gandhi comes forward. If her name is declared, everyone will welcome it. Not just for Congress, Priyanka Gandhi’s leadership is necessary for the entire country. She has been very active in Uttar Pradesh politics and Congress has benefited just not in that state but throughout the country,” he said.

Agency reports quoted PR minister P C Sharma as saying that people see Indira Gandhi's image in Priyanka. “Priyanka Gandhiji should be sent to Rajya Sabha from Madhya Pradesh, or any other state in that case. This will strengthen the party,” he told reporters. He told TOI that AICC president Sonia Gandhi will decide on Priyanka’s nomination to Rajya Sabha.

If Priyanka were to be nominated from Madhya Pradesh, Congress will have a tough choice to make for the second seat. It could be a toss-up between Digvijaya and former Guna MP Jyotiraditya Scindia.

Title: Dehradun: Police arrest three notorious thieves, recover stolen valuables
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Representative Image

DEHRADUN: Dehradun police on Monday arrested three notorious thieves who allegedly targeted two-wheelers and bikes of college students and lifted valuables such as cash, ATM cards and wallets by breaking the locks of the storage.

The arrested accused, identified as Prince Kumar, Dharmendra and Jitendra, all residents of Ghaziabad in Uttar Pradesh, broke the storage locks of bikes and scooters parked inside the DAV PG College while the students were busy giving their examination, said police.

“On February 10, they lifted valuables from seven two-wheelers of college students who were giving their examination and had parked their vehicles in the parking lot. Some of the wallets had cash and ATM cards as well. They even withdrew Rs 25,000 using one of the stolen ATM card,” said Dehradun SSP Arun Mohan Joshi.

After receiving a complaint, police filed an FIR under section 379 (theft) of Indian Penal Code (IPC) and formed a team to arrest the culprits. CCTV footage showed a few people engaged in suspicious activities in the parking lot. “CCTV footage of ATM from where the money was withdrawn was also taken,” said a police officer.

In the meantime, police identified the vehicle used in the crime , which was registered in Ghaziabad and sent a police team there to nab them. However, during investigation, it was found out that all three are in Dehradun. All three were finally arrested from EC Road.

According to SSP Dehradun, “During investigation, it emerged that Prince is the kingpin, and with the help of Dharmendra and Jitendra, he dupe people through ATM cloning.” Police have recovered three mobile phones, Rs 9,800 and the car used in the crime from them.

Title: Goa government shuns Lokayukta’s orders in over 50% cases
Content:
This story is from February 18, 2020

Goa CM Pramod Pandurang Sawant

PANAJI: In over 50% of the cases, the state government has accepted recommendations and guidelines issued by the Goa Lokayukta. Of the 13 cases disposed, in eight the government accepted recommendations, while in five it is yet to take action. The Lokayukta had also submitted recommendations in four other cases, but no compliance was sought when the cases were disposed.

The state government has to submit a compliance report within three months to the Lokayukta.

In the multi-crore beach cleaning scam case, Goa Lokayukta had found then tourism minister Dilip Parulekar guilty of “favouritism”, besides other irregularities, and had recommended that the anti-corruption branch (ACB) of the vigilance department reopen investigation. It also said that the government should consider referring the matter to CBI.

In his recommendation sent to the government, then chairperson, former Patna high court chief justice P K Misra, had said that ACB should reopen the investigation, particularly keeping in view the possibility of conspiracy and any kickbacks.

As per RTI information, in the Parulekar case, public information officer Laxman Zalmi said that the Lokayukta did not seek any compliance report from the government.

Regarding the renewal of 88 mining leases between November 2014 and January 2015, the Lokayukta recommended that ACB file an FIR against former chief minister Laxmikant Parsekar, former mines secretary Pawan Kumar Sain and former mines director Prasanna Acharya in connection with the alleged “corruption” and “criminal conspiracy”. Misra also said that Sain and Acharya shouldn’t hold offices.

In the mining case, Zalmi said that the action taken report is awaited.

In one case, as the government did not submit the compliance report, Zalmi said it has been deemed accepted, and the sarpanch deemed to have vacated his office with effect from December 16, 2019. The Lokayukta said that on the basis of finding that the complaint has been substantiated against the sarpanch, the public functionary should not continue to hold office of sarpanch and or ward member of the panchayat.
